0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	133	Oligomeric Stability of the Protease-digested Sec61 Complex As visualized by electron microscopy, the purified Sec61 complex forms oligomers that are composed of three to four Sec61 heterotrimers (Hanein et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	134	 Before assaying the protease-digested PK-RM for Sec61-dependent translocation and ribosome binding activities, it was important to determine whether the oligomeric state of the channel had been altered by protease digestion.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	135	 Sedimentation velocity measurements of protein to detergent complexes have been used to distinguish between monomeric and oligomeric forms of integral membrane proteins (Copeland et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	136	 1986 ; Doms and Helenius 1986 ; Hebert and Carruthers 1991 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	137	 The undigested and protease-digested PK-RM were solubilized with the nonionic detergent digitonin so that the sedimentation velocity of the intact and protease-digested Sec61 complexes could be compared using digitonin high salt glycerol gradients (Fig 2 A).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	138	 When the undigested T0-PK-RM membranes were analyzed, protein immunoblot analysis showed that Sec61 (a) was resolved from SRss (e), a subunit of the 100-kD SRP receptor, and from ribophorin I (f), a subunit of the oligosaccharyltransferase (OST).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	139	 As expected, Sec61ss (b) and Sec61 (not shown) cosedimented with Sec61.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	140	 The OST serves as a useful internal sedimentation marker (peak in 9 to 11, 11S) corresponding to a protein molecular mass of 300 kD (Kelleher and Gilmore 1997 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	141	 The less rapid sedimentation of Sec61 (fractions 6 to 9) relative to the OST would be consistent with a Sec61 oligomer composed of three to four 70-kD Sec61 heterotrimers.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	142	 Sec61 subunits severed in loop 8 (L8NTF) and loop 6 (L6NTF) cosedimented precisely with intact Sec61 when the T1-PK-RM were analyzed (Fig 2 A, c).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	143	 The sedimentation rate of Sec61 was also not altered by quantitative cleavage of Sec61 in loops 6, 8, and the COOH terminus by trypsin (d).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	144	 When the intact Sec61 complex was solubilized with Triton X-100, and then resolved on the digitonin high salt glycerol gradient, Sec61ss (h) sedimented far less rapidly and was well resolved from Sec61 (g).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	145	 Resolution of Sec61 and Sec61ss is consistent with a Triton X-100 to induced dissociation of the Sec61 oligomer into individual subunits.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	146	 Because Sec61 accounts for 75% of the protein molecular mass of the Sec61 complex, the Triton X-100 to treated Sec61 subunit provides an approximate sedimentation marker for a Sec61 heterotrimer.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	147	 Aliquots of the intact and protease-digested Sec61 complexes were mixed before glycerol gradient centrifugation (Fig 2 B).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	148	 The intact Sec61 subunits, which were derived from the undigested PK-RM, cosedimented with the NH2-terminal 22-kD fragment, which was derived from the C50-PK-RM (a) or from the Th25 PK-RM (b).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	149	 As observed in A, the protease-digested Sec61 complexes were well resolved from the Triton X-100 to treated Sec61 (c).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	150	View larger version (17K):    Figure 2.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	151	 Oligomeric structure of the protease-digested Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	152	 (A) Glycerol gradient centrifugation of digitonin high salt extracts of TX-PK-RM (a to f) or Triton X-100 high salt extracts of T0-PK-RM (g and h).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	153	 The following samples were analyzed: (a, b, and e to h) T0-PK-RM, (c) T1-PK-RM, and (d) T20-PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	154	 (B) Glycerol gradient centrifugation of detergent high salt extracts of the following samples: (a) T0-PK-RM mixed with C50-PK-RM; (b) T0-PK-RM mixed with Th25-PK-RM; and (c) T0-PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	155	 The protease-digested PK-RM were solubilized in a digitonin high salt buffer (a and b) or in a Triton X-100 high salt buffer (c).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	156	 In A and B, all detergent extracts were analyzed on digitonin high salt glycerol gradients.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	157	 (C) Superose 12 chromatography of digitonin high salt extracts of TX-PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	158	 The following samples were analyzed: (a) T0-PK-RM, (b) T1-PK-RM, (c) T7-PK-RM, and (d) T20-PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	159	 Aliquots of the solubilized TX-PK-RM (L in C) and each fraction from the glycerol gradients (A and B) and selected fractions from the Superose 12 columns (C) were analyzed on protein immunoblots using antibodies to the NH2 terminus of Sec61 (all samples except A; b, e, f, and h), Sec61ss (A, b and h), SRss (A, e) or ribophorin I (A, f).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	160	 L8NTF and L6NTF designate NH2-terminal fragments of Sec61 severed in cytoplasmic loops 8 and 6, respectively.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	161	A dissociation of the translocation channel into Sec61 heterotrimers would result in a simultaneous decrease in mass and an alteration in shape.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	162	 To insure that a compensatory shape change did not mask the conversion of an oligomeric ring into heterotrimers, we analyzed the intact and protease-digested Sec61 complexes by gel filtration chromatography in a digitonin high salt buffer (Fig 2 C).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	163	 Detergent-solubilized Sec61 complexes, from undigested membranes (sample a), eluted in the same fractions as the NH2-terminal fragments of Sec61 that were derived by trypsin digestion in loops 6 or 8 (samples b-d), indicating that the Stokes radius of the particle was not altered.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	164	 Taken together with the glycerol gradient centrifugation data, the gel filtration chromatography experiments demonstrate that the Sec61 oligomer does not dissociate into heterotrimers or isolated subunits when Sec61 is severed in cytoplasmic loops 6 and 8, and the COOH terminus.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	165	Ribosome Binding Is Abrogated by Proteolysis of Sec61 Now that we have defined which segments of the Sec61 complex are susceptible to protease digestion and have shown that Sec61 oligomers remain intact, we assayed the protease-digested PK-RM for ribosome binding activity to investigate the role of the cytoplasmic domains of the Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	166	 Ribosome binding to the protease-digested PK-RM was assayed by incubating the membranes with a fixed amount of 125I-labeled ribosomes and increasing amounts of unlabeled ribosomes (Fig 3 A).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	167	 A physiological ionic strength buffer (150 mM potassium acetates) was used in these assays to minimize nonspecific binding of ribosomes to other RER membrane proteins (Kalies et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	168	 Nonlinear least squares analysis of the binding data indicated that the undigested PK-RM bind 0.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	169	36 pmol of ribosomes/eq with a binding affinity (Kd 18 nM), which is a value comparable to previous reports (Kalies et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	170	 The ribosome binding data for the C0-PK-RM, C1-PK-RM, C5-PK-RM, and C30-PK-RM are graphically displayed as Scatchard plots in Fig 3 A.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	171	 Notably, the number of ribosome binding sites per eq of the CX-PK-RM (X-intercept value) was substantially reduced by proteolysis of the microsomes.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	172	 The slope of a Scatchard plot is the negative reciprocal of the binding affinity (Kd).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	173	 The observation that the Scatchard plots are linear rather than curved indicates that proteolysis of the Sec61 complex does not lead to a mixed population of high affinity and low affinity ribosome binding sites.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	174	 The roughly parallel slopes of the Scatchard plots reveals that the residual binding sites present in the protease-digested PK-RM have a binding affinity that is not significantly lower (less than twofold) than the sites detected in the undigested PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	175	 We compared the number of ribosome binding sites/eq of protease-digested PK-RM to the percentage of intact Sec61 in the chymotrypsin-digested PK-RM (Fig 3 B).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	176	 The inhibition of ribosome binding activity by chymotrypsin digestion correlated quite well with digestion of Sec61.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	177	 The reduction in ribosome binding activity observed for the C1-PK-RM was of particular interest because low concentrations of chymotrypsin sever Sec61 uniquely within cytoplasmic loop 8, yielding an NH2-terminal fragment (L8NTF) and a COOH-terminal fragment (L8CTF; Fig 3 C).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	178	 More extensive digestion of the PK-RM (e.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	179	, C30-PK-RM) cleaves Sec61 within loops 6 and 8 and causes a loss of COOH-terminal immunoreactivity.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	180	View larger version (33K):    Figure 3.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	181	 Ribosome binding to trypsin and chymotrypsin-digested PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	182	 (A, B, and D) Aliquots (5 eq) of the CX-PK-RM and TX-PK-RM were incubated with 0.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	183	18 pmol of 125I-labeled canine ribosomes and between 0.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	184	5 pmol of unlabeled ribosomes in 50 mM TEA, 150 mM potassium acetate, 5 mM magnesium acetate, and 1 mM DTT (TKMD).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	185	 Membrane-bound ribosomes were separated from unbound ribosomes by gel filtration chromatography as described in Materials and Methods.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	186	 (A) The ribosome binding affinity and the number of ribosome binding sites per eq of the protease-digested PK-RM were calculated as described in Materials and Methods.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	187	 The results are displayed as Scatchard plots for the C0-PK-RM (squares), C1-PK-RM (circles), C5-PK-RM (triangles), or C30-PK-RM (open squares).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	188	 Ribosome binding activities of the CX-PK-RM (B) and TX-PK-RM (D) are expressed as a percentage (triangles) of that displayed by undigested PK-RM (360 fmol/eq).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	189	 The percentage of intact Sec61 (squares) in the TX-PK-RM and CX-PK-RM was quantified by scanning protein immunoblots.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	190	 Aliquots of the TX-PK-RM (not shown) and CX-PK-RM (C) were subjected to protein immunoblot analysis using antibodies specific for the NH2 terminus or COOH terminus of Sec61 that are respectively designated as Sec61(N) and Sec61(C).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	191	 L8NTF and L6NTF designate NH2-terminal fragments of Sec61 severed in cytoplasmic loops 8 and 6, respectively; L8CTF designates a COOH-terminal fragment of Sec61 severed in loop 8.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	192	The number of ribosome binding sites was reduced fourfold when 55% of the Sec61 was digested in the T1-PK-RM (Fig 3 D).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	193	 Conceivably, the more dramatic effect of trypsin digestion on the ribosome binding activity of the Sec61 complex could be explained by the liberation of cytoplasmic Sec61 segments, which are crucial for ribosome binding.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	194	 One limitation of mapping protease cleavage sites by protein immunoblot analysis is that we cannot determine whether the Sec61 subunits have single or multiple cleavage sites within loops 6 and 8.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	195	 Two cleavages within a single loop would release a soluble tryptic peptide.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	196	 The V200-PK-RM did not bind ribosomes (not shown).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	197	Previous studies that predated the identification of the Sec61 complex as the ribosome receptor had shown that trypsin digestion of ribosome-stripped microsomes inhibits the subsequent rebinding of 80S ribosomes (Borgese et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	198	 In these earlier studies, ribosome binding to the membranes was assayed under low ionic strength conditions that permit ribosome binding to the p180 protein (Savitz and Meyer 1990 , Savitz and Meyer 1993 ) as well as the Sec61 complex (Kalies et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	199	 Because p180 is very sensitive to trypsin digestion (Kalies et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	200	 1994 ), we reasoned that the TX-PK-RM could be assayed for ribosome binding activity in hypotonic buffers (50 mM Tris-Cl, pH 7.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	201	5, 25 mM KCl, 5 mM MgCl2) without interference from p180.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	202	 The T5-PK-RM that lack intact Sec61 do not bind ribosomes in a hypotonic buffer (not shown).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	203	 The latter result confirms the previous reports concerning the trypsin sensitivity of ribosome binding sites in mammalian RER (Borgese et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	204	RNC Interactions with Protease-digested Sec61 Complexes Two distinct interactions are thought to be responsible for attachment of an RNC to the RER (Adelman et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	205	 1973 ; Gilmore and Blobel 1985 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	206	 One interaction is the ionic strength to sensitive binding of the ribosome to the Sec61 complex (Kalies et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	207	 1994 ), which was assayed in the preceding experiments.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	208	 Unlike nontranslating ribosomes that are readily detached from microsomes by 0.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	209	5 M potassium acetate, RNCs remain tightly bound to the membrane in high salt (Gilmore and Blobel 1985 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	210	 This ionic strength to insensitive interaction between the RNC and the membrane is dependent upon the presence of the nascent polypeptide, and occurs upon signal sequence insertion into the translocation channel (Jungnickel and Rapoport 1995 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	211	To determine whether RNC binding to the protease-digested PK-RM was reduced, we took advantage of the observation that RNCs will bind to vacant translocation channels in an SRP-independent reaction (Jungnickel and Rapoport 1995 ; Lauring et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	212	 1995a ; Raden and Gilmore 1998 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	213	 A substrate for the RNC binding experiments was prepared by translating a truncated mRNA encoding the NH2-terminal 86 residues of preprolactin (pPL86) in a wheat germ system in the absence of SRP.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	214	 RNCs that are bound to translocation channels can be separated from unbound RNCs by centrifugal flotation through a sucrose density gradient in either low (150 mM potassium acetate) or high salt (500 mM potassium acetate; Lauring et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	215	 The membrane-bound RNCs are recovered at the interface between the low density top and middle fractions (T and M), whereas the unbound RNCs remain in the high density bottom (B) fraction (Fig 4 A, T0-PK-RM).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	216	 When the trypsin-digested PK-RM were assayed using a low salt sucrose gradient, the RNCs did not remain with the membrane vesicles, but were instead recovered exclusively in the bottom fraction (Fig 4 A).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	217	 Clearly, the interaction between the RNC and the Sec61 channel is unstable when Sec61 subunits are severed.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	218	View larger version (26K):    Figure 4.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	219	 Proteolysis-induced changes in the ribosome to membrane junction.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	220	 The pPL86 and ffLuc77 mRNAs were translated in the absence of SRP to assemble RNCs.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	221	 The translation products were incubated with the TX-PK-RM or CX-PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	222	 The individual assays were chilled on ice, and binding of RNCs to the protease-digested PK-RM was assayed as follows.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	223	 (A) Binding of RNCs to TX-PK-RM was assayed by adjusting samples to 2.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	224	1 M sucrose and applying them as the bottom layer of a three-step discontinuous sucrose gradient (see Materials and Methods).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	225	 After centrifugation, membrane-bound pPL86 was recovered in the top (T) and middle (M) fractions, whereas unbound pPL86 remained in the bottom (B) fraction.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	226	 (B) Membrane-bound RNCs were separated from unbound RNCs by gel filtration chromatography columns equilibrated in TKMD.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	227	 The percentage of the pPL86 that coeluted with the microsomes was quantified after SDS-PAGE.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	228	 (C) Membrane-bound RNCs were separated from unbound RNCs by gel filtration chromatography columns equilibrated in TKMD (L) or in TKMD adjusted to 500 mM potassium acetate (H).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	229	 Eluate fractions, containing pPL86 or ffLuc77-RNCs, were spotted onto Whatmann 3MM filter paper, precipitated in cold 10% TCA, and boiled in 5% TCA before scintillation counting.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	230	 In B and C, the percentage of RNCs that elute in the void volume of the column in the absence of PK-RM (7% of RNCs) has been subtracted as background.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	231	 (D) The samples were digested with proteinase K on ice as described in Materials and Methods.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	232	 The protease-resistant pPL86 is expressed as a percentage of the pPL86 in undigested control samples.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	233	Chromatography on a Sepharose CL-2B gel filtration column was used as a second method to separate membrane bound and unbound RNCs.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	234	 More than 60% of the pPL86 RNCs coeluted with the undigested T0-PK-RM in the void volume of the gel filtration column that was equilibrated in 150 mM potassium acetate (Fig 4 B).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	235	 The C5-PK-RM, which had shown a threefold reduction in the binding of nontranslating ribosomes, displayed a twofold decrease in RNC binding.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	236	 The C30-PK-RM and the T10-PK-RM, which had a 10-fold or greater defect in ribosome binding (Fig 3), bound 2.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	237	7-fold and 5-fold less RNCs than the undigested PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	238	 RNCs that bind to intact Sec61 complexes resist extraction with 0.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	239	5 M potassium acetate, which is consistent with nascent chain insertion into the translocation channel (Fig 4 C).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	240	 The majority (80%) of the pPL86 RNCs that bind to the protease-digested PK-RM (C30-PK-RM) were also insensitive to high salt extraction (Fig 4 C).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	241	 To determine whether binding of RNCs to the Sec61 complex was signal sequence to independent, we incubated intact and protease-digested microsomes (T10-PK-RM and C30-PK-RM) with RNCs that were assembled by translation of a truncated firefly luciferase mRNA (ffLuc77).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	242	 As reported previously (Lauring et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	243	 1995b ), translocation channels in the PK-RM will bind RNCs that lack a signal sequence (Fig 4 C).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	244	 Binding of the ffLuc77 RNCs to the protease-digested PK-RM was either scarcely above background (T10-PK-RM) or 3.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	245	5-fold reduced (C30-PK-RM) relative to intact microsomes (Fig 4 C).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	246	When the nascent polypeptide is inserted into the translocation channel, it resides in an environment that is inaccessible to proteases (Connolly et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	247	 Intimate contact between the cytosolic domains of the Sec61 complex and the ribosome is thought to be responsible for maintaining a tight seal between the ribosome and the membrane surface during translocation of proteins across the RER (Crowley et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	248	 The interaction between the protease-digested translocation channel and the RNC was analyzed by testing whether a nascent polypeptide was sensitive to proteolysis (Fig 4 D).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	249	 Nascent pPL86 was quantitatively digested by proteinase K in the absence of the microsomes.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	250	 In the experiment shown here, 28% of the nascent pPL86 chains were protected from proteinase K digestion when we assayed the T0-PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	251	 The percentage of protease-inaccessible pPL86 is similar to the typical efficiency (35 to 50%) for SRP-independent translocation reactions (see Fig 5).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	252	 A far smaller proportion (1 to 6%) of the nascent polypeptides was protected from proteinase K upon attachment of RNCs to the trypsin-digested Sec61 complexes (Fig 4 D).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	253	 We can conclude that the ribosome to Sec61 junction is substantially altered when loops 6 and 8 of Sec61 are severed.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	254	View larger version (44K):    Figure 5.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	255	 SRP-independent translocation activity of protease-digested PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	256	 The TX-PK-RM, CX-PK-RM, or V200-PK-RM were assayed for SRP-independent translocation of pPL86 as described in Materials and Methods.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	257	 (A and B) The assays contained 10  microl of translation products and 10 eq of TX-PK-RM, V200-PK-RM (A), or CX-PK-RM (B).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	258	 The percent translocation (solid bars) was calculated by quantifying pPL86 and PL56 after resolution by PAGE in SDS, and is expressed relative to that observed with undigested membranes (T0-PK-RM or C0-PK-RM).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	259	 The ribosome binding activity (shaded bars) of the TX-PK-RM, CX-PK-RM, or V200-PK-RM is taken from Fig 3.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	260	 (C) Aliquots (10  microl) of the pPL86 translation products were incubated with 0, 1, 3, or 10 eq of T0-PK-RM (filled squares), T1-PK-RM (triangles), T10-PK-RM (circles), or T30-PK-RM (open squares).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	261	 (D) Competition between wheat germ 80S ribosomes and RNCs for binding to intact and protease-digested translocation channels.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	262	5 pmol of 80S ribosomes, 250 fmol of pPL86-RNCs) were mixed with 0 to 22.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	263	5 pmol of purified 80S ribosomes and T0-PK-RM (triangles) or T3-PK-RM (squares).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	264	5 pmol corresponds to 1x competing ribosomes.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	265	 The assays contained 5 eq of T0-PK-RM (1.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	266	5 pmol of Sec61 oligomers) or 15 eq of T3-PK-RM (4.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	267	 Greater amounts of T3-PK-RM were assayed to obtain comparable extents of translocation in the absence of competing ribosomes.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	268	SRP-independent Translocation across Protease-digested PK-RM Based upon the results described above, we anticipated that the extensively digested PK-RM would be inactive in an SRP-independent translocation assay, whereas the microsomes that retained significant ribosome binding activity (e.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	269	, T1-PK-RM or C5-PK-RM) would show SRP-independent translocation defects that were proportional to the fold reduction in ribosome binding or RNC binding activities.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	270	 To simplify the interpretation of SRP-independent translocation assays, we used the TRAM protein to independent substrate pPL86 for these experiments (Gorlich and Rapoport 1993 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	271	 The ribosome to pPL86 complexes were incubated with the protease-digested PK-RM for 5 min to allow RNC binding to the Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	272	 RNCs that had engaged the translocation channel were detected by releasing the nascent polypeptide with EDTA, which permits translocation of pPL86 into the ER lumen, where it is processed to PL56 by cleavage of the signal sequence.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	273	 All of the protease-digested PK-RM were assayed for SRP-independent translocation activity.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	274	 Representative assays using 10 eq of the protease-digested PK-RM (3 pmol of Sec61 oligomers) and 10  microl of wheat germ translation products (4.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	275	5 pmol of ribosomes, 250 fmol of pPL86 RNCs) are shown in Fig 5 (A and B).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	276	 Surprisingly, trypsin or endoproteinase Glu-C digestion of Sec61 reduced SRP-independent translocation of pPL86 by, at most, twofold (Fig 5 A, solid bars).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	277	 Even more striking, chymotrypsin digestion of Sec61 caused no more than a 20% reduction in SRP-independent translocation activity (Fig 5 B, solid bars).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	278	 Binding of nontranslating ribosomes to the protease-digested membranes was more severely inhibited than the SRP-independent translocation activity (Fig 5A and Fig B, shaded bars).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	279	 Control experiments demonstrated that the processed PL56 was sequestered within microsomal vesicles.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	280	The trypsin-digested membranes (T1-PK-RM, T10-PK-RM, and T30-PK-RM) were assayed for SRP-independent translocation activity under conditions where 80S ribosomes were present in excess relative to RNC binding sites in the undigested PK-RM (Fig 5 C).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	281	 Translocation of pPL86 across the protease-severed Sec61 channels was proportional to the quantity of added microsomes.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	282	 When limiting amounts of protease-digested PK-RM were assayed (1 eq), the extensively digested PK-RM (T10-PK-RM and T30-PK-RM) were threefold less active than undigested PK-RM in SRP-independent translocation of pPL86.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	283	 Thus, even when the RNCs are in excess relative to the TX-PK-RM, the fold reduction in translocation activity is considerably less than the observed reduction in the ribosome binding or RNC binding activities.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	284	We next used a sensitive competition assay to determine whether the protease-digested Sec61 complexes retain residual binding determinants for 80S ribosomes that were not detected using the classical ribosome binding assay shown in Fig 3.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	285	 Nontranslating 80S ribosomes compete with RNCs for binding to the Sec61 complex, hence, they act as competitive inhibitors of the SRP-independent targeting pathway (Lauring et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	286	 1998 ; Raden and Gilmore 1998 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	287	 We reasoned that the T3-PK-RM, which retain 5% of the high affinity ribosome binding sites detectable in intact PK-RM (Fig 3 D), might be less sensitive to inhibition by 80S ribosomes when assayed for SRP-independent translocation activity.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	288	 To allow a direct comparison of the effect of competing ribosomes, the competition assays were adjusted to obtain comparable translocation activity in the absence of the competitor.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	289	 As observed previously, the addition of 80S ribosomes caused a concentration-dependent decrease in SRP-independent translocation across the undigested PK-RM (Fig 5 D, triangles).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	290	 When the protease-digested T3PK-RM were assayed, we observed that the 80S ribosomes were twofold less effective as inhibitors of SRP-independent translocation across the T3-PK-RM (Fig 5 D, squares).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	291	 Nonetheless, the 80S ribosomes did interfere with RNC binding to the Sec61 complex, suggesting that the protease-severed Sec61 complexes do retain residual affinity for the nontranslating ribosomes.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	292	Thermolysin Dissection of Sec61 Given the dramatic reduction in ribosome binding activity caused by cleavage of Sec61 at multiple sites, we incubated the PK-RM with thermolysin on ice or at 25 degrees C to achieve more selective digestion of Sec61 (Fig 6 A).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	293	 The protein immunoblots using the NH2-terminal to specific antibody to Sec61 revealed proteolytic fragments for the 25 degrees C digestions that were similar to those obtained with chymotrypsin (compare Fig 6 A with Fig 3 C).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	294	 Proteolysis within loops 8 and 6 yielded 30- and 22-kD immunoreactive fragments of Sec61, respectively.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	295	 A more rapid loss of Sec61 immunoreactivity was observed when the blots were probed with the COOH-terminal to specific antibody (Fig 6 A).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	296	 Smaller immunoreactive fragments of Sec61 were not detected with either antibody.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	297	 Proteolysis within the 14-residue COOH-terminal tail should abolish immunoreactivity without substantially altering the gel mobility of Sec61.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	298	 When thermolysin digestions were performed on ice, the NH2-terminal antibody revealed limited digestion of Sec61 within loop 8.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	299	 Selective cleavage of the COOH-terminal tail was readily apparent, as shown by the loss of COOH-terminal immunoreactivity for the Th20-PK-RM and Th50-PK-RM (Fig 6 A).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	300	 Control immunoblots using the antibody to ribophorin I (Fig 6 A) showed that differences in Sec61 COOH-terminal immunoreactivity could not be explained by differential recovery of the protease-digested membranes during preparative procedures.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	301	 Quantification of the protein immunoblots disclosed the percentage of intact Sec61 that was recognized by the COOH-terminal antibody, and the intact-sized Sec61 that was recognized by the NH2-terminal antibody (Fig 6 B).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	302	 The difference between the NH2- and COOH-terminal values indicates the percentage of Sec61 that was selectively cleaved in the COOH-terminal tail.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	303	View larger version (41K):    Figure 6.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	304	 Ribosome binding activity of thermolysin-digested PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	305	 (A) PK-RM were digested at 25 degrees C or on ice with thermolysin as described in Materials and Methods.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	306	 Aliquots of the protease-digested PK-RM were analyzed on protein immunoblots probed with antibodies to Sec61 and ribophorin I.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	307	 Antibodies specific for the NH2 terminus or COOH terminus of Sec61 are designated as Sec61 (N) and Sec61 (C), respectively.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	308	 L8NTF and L6NTF designate NH2-terminal fragments of Sec61 severed in cytoplasmic loops 8 and 6, respectively.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	309	 (B) The protein immunoblots shown in A were quantified to calculate the percentage of intact-sized Sec61 that are recognized by antibodies to the NH2 terminus (shaded bars), or intact Sec61 that are recognized by the antibody to the COOH terminus (hatched bars).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	310	 Binding of 80S ribosomes to the ThX-PK-RM was assayed as described in Materials and Methods, and is expressed as a percentage (solid bars) of that displayed by undigested PK-RM (360 fmol/eq).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	311	The thermolysin-digested PK-RM were assayed for ribosome binding activity (Fig 6 B).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	312	 The quantity of ribosome binding sites (solid bars) was compared with the amount of intact Sec61 recognized by the NH2-terminal (shaded bars) and COOH-terminal (diagonal bars) antibodies.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	313	 A comparison of the ribosome binding activities of the Th2-PK-RM, Th20-PK-RM, and Th50-PK-RM revealed the critical importance of loop 8 and the COOH-terminal tail of Sec61.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	314	 The loss of ribosome binding activity by these three membrane preparations cannot be ascribed to digestion of loop 6, which remained intact, but instead must be dependent upon digestion of either loop 8, the COOH terminus or both segments.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	315	 The importance of the COOH-terminal tail of Sec61 is evident upon comparison of Th2-PK-RM and Th50-PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	316	 Although the extent of digestion within loop 8 was comparable, Th50-PK-RM lack the COOH-terminal tail of Sec61, and display threefold fewer ribosome binding sites.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	317	 The latter result demonstrates that an intact Sec61 COOH terminus is important for the interaction between an 80S ribosome and the translocation channel.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	318	The thermolysin-digested membranes were assayed for SRP-dependent translocation activity using the TRAM-independent substrate preprolactin (Gorlich and Rapoport 1993 ; Voigt et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	319	 To assay SRP-dependent translocation activity, preprolactin mRNA was translated in a reticulocyte lysate system in the presence of the thermolysin-digested PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	320	 The assays were further supplemented with the 52-kD SR fragment to reconstitute SRP receptor activity, as protein immunoblots had shown that the ThX-PK-RM lack intact SR (not shown).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	321	 Translocation of preprolactin across the membrane is accompanied by signal sequence cleavage to yield processed prolactin.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	322	 Quantification of the results (bottom) shows that the SRP-dependent translocation activity correlated quite well with the ribosome binding activity.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	323	 Translocation of preprolactin was abolished when Sec61 was severed in cytoplasmic loop 6 (e.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	324	, Th25-PK-RM) and was strongly inhibited when Sec61 was cleaved in loop 8 (Fig 7 A).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	325	 Similar results were obtained when we assayed SRP-dependent integration of op156, a ribosome-tethered nascent chain derived from bovine opsin (data not shown).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	326	View larger version (33K):    Figure 7.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	327	 Translocation activity of thermolysin-digested PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	328	 (A) The ThX-PK-RM were assayed for SRP-dependent translocation of preprolactin.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	329	 Reticulocyte lysate translations were programmed with a preprolactin mRNA transcript and were supplemented with 1.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	330	2 eq of ThX-PK-RM and 200 fmol of the 52-kD fragment of SR.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	331	 Preprolactin (pPL) and prolactin (PL) were resolved by SDS-PAGE.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	332	 SRP-dependent translocation of preprolactin across the ThX-PK-RM (shaded bars), and ribosome binding to the ThX-PK-RM (solid bars) is expressed relative to that obtained with undigested PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	333	 (B) The ThX-PK-RM were assayed for SRP-independent translocation of pPL86.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	334	 pPL86 was resolved from PL56 and the signal sequence (SS) by SDS-PAGE.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	335	 SRP-independent translocation of pPL86 across the ThX-PK-RM (shaded bars) and ribosome binding to the ThX-PK-RM (solid bars) is expressed relative to that obtained with undigested PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	336	The thermolysin-digested PK-RM were also assayed for SRP-independent translocation activity (Fig 7 B).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	337	 Quantification of the data revealed that the ribosome binding and SRP-independent translocation-promotion activities of the Sec61 complex are not strictly linked.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	338	 The COOH-terminal tail of Sec61 is dispensable for SRP-independent translocation activity.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	339	 The most severe reduction in the SRP-independent translocation of pPL86 was observed when Sec61 was cleaved in both loops 6 and 8.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	340	  Discussion Top Abstract Introduction Materials and Methods Results Discussion Acknowledgements References.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	341	Proteolysis of Sec61 The topology of Sec61 in the mammalian ER membrane was initially deduced using hydropathy algorithms (Gorlich et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	342	 1992 ) and by comparison to the experimentally derived topology model for the homologous Escherichia coli SecY protein (Akiyama and Ito 1987 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	343	 The good agreement between the predicted topology of canine Sec61 and the experimentally verified topology model for S.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	344	 cerevisiae Sec61p (Wilkinson et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	345	 1996 ) lends considerable credence to the model depicted in Fig 1 A.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	346	 Here, proteolysis using enzymes with different cleavage specificities was used to identify surface-exposed loops on the cytoplasmic face of Sec61.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	347	 Based upon the presence of potential cleavage sites for trypsin, chymotrypsin, and endoproteinase Glu-C in each of the four loops and two termini, it was conceivable that each cytoplasmic segment of Sec61 would be susceptible to cleavage by all three proteases, with the exception of loop 6 which lacks a predicted cleavage site for endoproteinase Glu-C.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	348	 Instead, we observed that the COOH-terminal half of Sec61 was much more sensitive to proteolysis than the NH2-terminal tail, whereas loops 2 and 4 were not digested by any protease we tested.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	349	 Although a lack of digestion within loop 4 can be explained by the short length of this segment, loop 2 is comparable in length to loop 6, so size alone cannot be the explanation.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	350	 The relative insensitivity of the NH2 terminus is consistent with the hypothesis that this segment of canine Sec61 is embedded on the membrane surface as an amphipathic -helix as has been proposed for S.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	351	 cerevisiae Sec61p (Wilkinson et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	352	 However, we cannot exclude the possibility that the NH2 terminus of Sec61 is protected by another mechanism.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	353	 The selective digestion of the COOH-terminal tail by thermolysin on ice indicates that this segment of Sec61 is highly exposed on the surface of the Sec61 oligomer.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	354	Proteolysis of Sec61 did not cause the translocation channel to dissociate into Sec61 heterotrimers or fragments thereof.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	355	 The maintenance of the oligomeric structure was not unexpected as hydrophobic interactions between the TM spans of Sec61, Sec61ss, and Sec61 are presumably responsible for the stability of the oligomer.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	356	 Once we established that the oligomeric structure of the Sec61 complex was not compromised by proteolytic digestion of cytoplasmic loops, we assayed the protease-digested PK-RM for ribosome binding activity, SRP-independent translocation of pPL86, and SRP-dependent translocation of preprolactin.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	357	Binding of Nontranslating Ribosomes to the Sec61 Complex Several RER membrane proteins (Sec61 complex, p180 and p34) bind ribosomes in hypotonic solution when reconstituted into proteoliposomes (Ichimura et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	358	 1992 ; Savitz and Meyer 1993 ; Kalies et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	359	 However, Sec61 complex proteoliposomes retain a high affinity for ribosomes in a physiological ionic strength buffer (Kalies et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	360	 Furthermore, it is now well established that the Sec61 complex is also the ribosome binding site during the protein translocation reaction (Gorlich and Rapoport 1993 ; Kalies et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	361	 By analyzing ribosome binding to the protease-digested PK-RM in a physiological ionic strength buffer, our assay specifically monitored how proteolysis of the Sec61 complex altered binding of nontranslating ribosomes to the translocation channel.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	362	Our results support the hypothesis that the ribosome binding activity of the Sec61 complex can be ascribed to Sec61.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	363	 More than 50% of Sec61 remained intact in protease-digested membranes that lacked detectable ribosome binding (e.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	364	, T5-PK-RM and V200-PK-RM), demonstrating that Sec61 is not sufficient for ribosome binding activity.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	365	 The extreme sensitivity of Sec61ss to thermolysin digestion (not shown) yielded the Th2-PK-RM that lack intact Sec61ss yet retain considerable ribosome binding activity.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	366	 1994 had also concluded that Sec61ss was dispensable for ribosome binding to the Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	367	 However, we cannot exclude the possibility that Sec61ss or Sec61 help stabilize the association between the ribosome and Sec61.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	368	As the ultrastructural evidence indicates that the ribosome is tethered to the Sec61 complex via a single visible junction (Beckmann et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	369	 1997 ), it would be logical to suggest that the most exposed surface on Sec61 is the ribosome-binding site.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	370	 In support of the hypothesis that the most protease-accessible regions of Sec61 might correspond to the ribosome binding site, we observed that Sec61 complexes that lack intact Sec61 subunits do not bind nontranslating ribosomes.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	371	 A comparison of 12 eukaryotic Sec61 sequences reveals that loops 6 and 8 are highly conserved, particularly with respect to the location and number of charged amino acids.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	372	 Because the COOH terminus of Sec61 is one of the least conserved cytoplasmic segments of the Sec61 complex, an important role for the COOH terminus of Sec61 in ribosome binding was unexpected.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	373	 The results obtained with the C1-PK-RM and the Th2-PK-RM strongly support the hypothesis that loop 8 is required for ribosome binding to the Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	374	 Selective cleavage of the COOH-terminal tail of Sec61, by thermolysin on ice (Th50-PK-RM), showed that this segment of Sec61 is crucial for the binding of a nontranslating ribosome to the translocation channel.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	375	Assuming that proteolysis of the translocation channel results in a random digestion of Sec61 subunits in a tetramer of Sec61 heterotrimers, the partially digested membranes should contain a mixture of translocation channels that have between zero and four intact Sec61 subunits.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	376	 One unexpected result was the observation that ribosome binding to the protease-digested PK-RM requires more than one intact Sec61 subunit per translocation channel.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	377	 Consider an example of membranes that retain 50% intact Sec61 (e.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	378	 A random 50% digestion of tetrameric translocation channels would yield a binomial distribution of channels that contain zero to four intact Sec61 subunits (6.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	379	25% with zero intact, 25% with one intact, 37.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	380	5% with two intact, 25% with three intact, and 6.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	381	 The number of ribosome binding sites we detect in C1-PK-RM or Th2-PK-RM (40 to 50% of that present in PK-RM) is much greater than the 6% of complexes that retain four intact Sec61 subunits, and is much less than the 94% of complexes that retain at least one intact Sec61 subunit.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	382	 Instead, our results are best explained by a model that requires multivalent contact between the ribosome and two or three Sec61 subunits per Sec61 oligomer.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	383	 In this regard, our demonstration that the Sec61 oligomer remains intact following proteolysis was a critical observation.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	384	 Based upon the minimal protein bridge that tethers a ribosome to the yeast Sec61 oligomer (Beckmann et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	385	 1997 ), one might have predicted that three of the Sec61 subunits in a tetrameric translocation channel could be proteolyzed without reducing ribosome binding activity.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	386	 Our interpretation of this apparent paradox is that physiological salt-insensitive binding of the ribosome to the canine Sec61 complex requires one or more secondary contact points that were not observed in the three-dimensional reconstructions of the S.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	387	 cerevisiae ribosome-Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	388	The Signal Sequence Contributes to the Specificity and Affinity of RNC Attachment The three independent methods we used to analyze RNC binding provided evidence that protease-severed Sec61 complexes bind RNCs with a reduced capacity and a reduced affinity relative to intact Sec61 complexes.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	389	 Nonetheless, RNC binding to the Sec61 complex cannot be directly equated with high affinity ribosome binding activity.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	390	 Attachment of the pPL86 RNCs to Sec61 complexes that lack high affinity ribosome binding activity is most readily explained by the hypothesis that the signal sequence of the nascent polypeptide is a second ligand that contributes significantly to the specificity and affinity of the interaction between an RNC and the Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	391	 RNCs that lack a signal sequence (e.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	392	, ffLuc77) bind poorly to the protease-digested Sec61 complexes.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	393	 How can we rationalize this conclusion with the previous data showing that 80S ribosomes compete with RNCs for SRP-independent binding to the translocation channel? As noted previously (Raden and Gilmore 1998 ), 80S ribosomes do not compete on a 1:1 basis with RNCs for binding to the Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	394	 We hypothesize that the signal sequence substantially enhances the affinity of the RNC for the translocation channel by reducing the dissociation rate of the ribosome from the Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	395	 When ribosome competition experiments were conducted using the protease-digested PK-RM, we observed that free ribosomes were twofold less effective as competitors of RNC binding, which is consistent with the view that the affinity between the ribosome and the Sec61 complex was reduced by proteolysis.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	396	 Photo cross-linking studies indicate that the signal sequence of a nascent polypeptide is inserted into the yeast Sec61 complex, so that it contacts TM spans 2 and 7 (Plath et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	397	 Our results strongly suggest that signal sequence insertion occurs in a region of Sec61 that is inaccessible to proteases, hence, it is distinct from the cytoplasmic loops that contact the ribosome.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	398	SRP-independent Translocation of Polypeptides through Protease-digested Sec61 Complexes SRP-independent translocation through the Sec61 complex is thought to accurately mimic the RNC binding, nascent chain insertion and transport phases of the translocation reaction.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	399	 When RNCs are targeted by the SRP-independent pathway, binding of the RNC to the Sec61 complex is signal sequence to independent (Lauring et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	400	 1995a ), and is competitively inhibited by the presence of nontranslating 80S ribosomes (Lauring et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	401	 1998 ; Raden and Gilmore 1998 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	402	 All of the SRP-independent translocation assays described here used RNC preparations that contained the nascent chain to associated complex (NAC).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	403	 NAC, a ribosome-associated protein, is proposed to be a negative regulator of RNC binding to the Sec61 complex (Lauring et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	404	 However, this conclusion has been challenged because the endogenous NAC in wheat germ and reticulocyte lysate cytosol does not prevent RNC binding to the Sec61 complex (Neuhof et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	405	 1998 ; Raden and Gilmore 1998 ), therefore, removal of NAC was not necessary.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	406	When we assayed SRP-independent translocation across the protease-digested PK-RM, we made several unexpected observations.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	407	 Protease-digested PK-RM that lack binding sites for nontranslating ribosomes remain competent for SRP-independent translocation of pPL86.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	408	 These results indicate that a functional interaction between a nascent polypeptide and the translocation channel is not strictly dependent upon an initial high affinity binding of the ribosome to Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	409	 The most definitive resolution of the ribosome binding and the translocation promotion activities of the Sec61 complex was obtained by limited digestion of Sec61 with thermolysin.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	410	 Cleavage of the COOH terminus of Sec61 drastically reduced ribosome-binding activity while having a relatively modest effect upon SRP-independent translocation of pPL86.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	411	The interaction between an RNC and the Sec61 complex progresses through several distinct stages as the nascent polypeptide increases in length (Crowley et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	412	 1994 ; Jungnickel and Rapoport 1995 ; Nicchitta and Zheng 1997 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	413	 RNCs bearing preprolactin chains that are shorter than 70 residues are attached in a salt-sensitive manner even though the nascent polypeptide is in contact with Sec61.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	414	 Salt-resistant RNC attachment occurs upon further elongation when the signal sequence is inserted into a protease-inaccessible environment in the translocation channel (Connolly et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	415	 1989 ; Jungnickel and Rapoport 1995 ; Nicchitta and Zheng 1997 ).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	416	 Gating of the lumenal end of the translocation channel also occurs at this stage of nascent chain elongation and transport (Crowley et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	417	 Although the pPL86 nascent chain is of sufficient length to support the more stable interaction between an RNC and the Sec61 complex, we observed that the interaction between an RNC and the translocation channel was substantially weakened by proteolysis of Sec61.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	418	 RNCs bearing pPL86 did not remain attached to the protease-digested PK-RM on sucrose flotation gradients in a physiological ionic strength buffer (Fig 4 A).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	419	 Gel filtration chromatography, which avoids exposure of the sample to 2 M sucrose and high centrifugal fields, provided evidence that the RNCs were bound to the protease-digested PK-RM (Fig 4B and Fig C).
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	420	 Further evidence that the RNC to Sec61 interaction was altered was provided by the finding that the junction between the ribosome and the membrane was not sufficiently tight to prevent access of a macromolecular probe (proteinase K) to the nascent polypeptide.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	421	Regions of Sec61 Implicated in RNC Binding and Protein Translocation All of the protease-digested PK-RM described here were also assayed for SRP-dependent translocation activity using the procedure shown in Fig 7 A (Song et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	422	 As shown here for the Th25-PK-RM, digestion of Sec61 in either cytoplasmic loop 6 or loop 8 leads to a complete block in the SRP-dependent translocation pathway.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	423	 The restrictive block of the SRP-dependent targeting pathway is most readily explained by the accumulation of an upstream translocation intermediate that precedes transfer of the RNC from SRP54 to Sec61 (Song et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	424	 The SRP-independent pathway was not as severely inhibited by proteolysis of Sec61; cleavage within loops 6 and 8 reduced RNC binding and nascent chain translocation.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	425	 Although the moderate reduction in SRP-independent translocation activity probably reflects the reduced affinity of the translocation channel for the ribosome, our results strongly suggest that the translocation-promoting function of the Sec61 complex resides in a protease-inaccessible region of Sec61.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	426	 A molecular genetic dissection of Sec61p has suggested that an intact cytoplasmic loop 6 is crucial for the in vivo function of the Sec61 complex (Wilkinson et al.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	427	 Complementary NH2-and COOH-terminal segments of Sec61p were tested for the ability to suppress a sec61 null allele.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	428	 With the exception of NH2-terminal segments truncated within loops 6 or 7, coexpression of the complementary fragment yielded a functional Sec61p.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	429	 Thus, an intact loop 6 in Sec61 appears to be crucial for translocation of proteins across the ER.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	430	 Our results indicate that loop 8 and the COOH terminus are required for high affinity binding of ribosome to the Sec61 complex.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	431	 We propose that these two segments cooperate to form a ribosome-binding platform that is responsible for both the primary and secondary contacts between the translocation channel and the ribosome.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	432	 Whereas a detailed description of the ribosome-binding site in Sec61 will require further ultrastructural and molecular genetic analysis, the results described here show that the COOH-terminal half of Sec61 should be the focus for further scrutiny.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	433	1 Abbreviations used in this paper: CX-PK-RM, chymotrypsin-digested PK-RM; ECL, enhanced chemiluminescence; NAC, nascent chain to associated complex; OST, oligosaccharyltransferase; PIC, protease inhibitor cocktail; PK-RM, puromycin high salt to washed RM; RM, rough microsomes; RNC, ribosome nascent chain complex; SR, signal recognition particle receptor; SRP, signal recognition particle; TEA, triethanolamine acetate, pH 7.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	434	5; TM, transmembrane; TX-PK-RM, trypsin-digested PK-RM; ThX-PK-RM, thermolysin-digested PK-RM; VX-PK-RM, endoproteinase Glu-C to digested PK-RM.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	435	  Acknowledgements Top Abstract Introduction Materials and Methods Results Discussion Acknowledgements References.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	436	We thank Gert Kreibich, Chistopher Nicchitta, Tom Rapoport, and Peter Walter for providing antibodies to ribophorin I, Sec61, and Sec61ss, and SRss, respectively.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	437	 We thank Kennan Kellaris (Georgetown University, Washington, DC) for raising antisera to the COOH terminus of Sec61 while she was a postdoctoral fellow in this lab.
0.43387523.10893256.html.plaintext.txt	438	This work was supported by National Institutes of Health grant PHS GM 35687.
