0.44482413.11707463.html.plaintext.txt	516	Copyright   2002 by The American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, Inc.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	0	Functional human CFTR produced by stable Chinese hamster ovary cell lines derived using yeast artificial chromosomes Functional human CFTR produced by stable Chinese hamster ovary cell lines derived using yeast artificial chromosomes Peter J.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	1	 Guggino4, Yuan Jiang2 and Melissa A.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	2	1Laboratories of Gene Transfer and 2Cancer Genetics, National Center for Human Genome Research, National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, Maryland 20892, USA and Departments of 3Pediatrics, Anesthesia and Critical Care Medicine and 4Physiology, Johns Hopkins Medical Institutions, Baltimore, Maryland 21287, USA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	3	Received July 29, 1996; Revised and Accepted November 5, 1996.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	4	The cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator gene (CFTR) encodes a transmembrane protein (CFTR) which functions in part as a cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP)-regulated chloride channel.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	5	 CFTR expression is controlled temporally and cell specifically by mechanisms that are poorly understood.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	6	 Insight into CFTR regulation could be facilitated by the successful introduction of the entire 230 kb human CFTR and adjacent sequences into mammalian cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	7	 To this end, we have introduced two different CFTR-containing yeast artificial chromosomes (YACs) (320 and 620 kb) into Chinese hamster ovary-K1 (CHO) cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	8	 Clonal cell lines containing human CFTR were identified by PCR, and the genetic and functional analyses of one clone containing each YAC are described.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	9	 Integration of the human CFTR-containing YACs into the CHO genome at a unique site in each cell line was demonstrated by fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	10	 Southern blot analysis suggested that on the order of one copy of human CFTR was integrated per CHO cell genome.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	11	 Fiber-FISH and restriction analysis suggested that CFTR remained grossly intact.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	12	 Northern analysis showed full-length, human CFTR mRNA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	13	 Immunoprecipitation followed by phosphorylation with protein kinase demonstrated mature, glycosylated CFTR.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	14	 Finally, chloride secretion in response to cAMP indicated the functional nature of the human CFTR.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	15	 This study provides several novel results including: (i) functional human CFTRcan be expressed from these YACs; (ii) CHO cells are a permissive environment for expression of human CFTR; (iii) the level of human CFTR expression in CHO cells is unexpectedly high given the lack of endogenous CFTR production; and (iv) the suggestion by Fiber-FISH of CFTR integrity correlates with functional gene expression.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	16	 These YACs and the cell lines derived from them should be useful tools for the study of CFTR expression.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	17	Cystic fibrosis (CF) is the most common fatal autosomal recessive disorder in the Caucasian population (1 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	18	 It is caused by mutations in the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator gene (CFTR) leading to the loss of cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP)-stimulated chloride efflux from epithelial cells (2 -4 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	19	 CFTR is a 230 kb gene encoding a 1480 amino acid transmembrane protein which functions as a chloride channel with several other regulatory properties (5 ,6 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	20	 More than 600 mutations in CFTR have been identified in individuals with CF (7 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	21	 The most common mutation, a deletion of 3 bp leading to the loss of a phenylalanine residue at position 508, is found in nearly 70% of CF alleles (8 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	22	CFTR is expressed primarily in exocrine epithelia from the lung, gastrointestinal tract, pancreas and sweat glands (9 -11 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	23	 The expression is generally low in these tissues, although a few specific epithelial cell types, such as the serous cells in the submucosal glands of the lung, have relatively high level expression (12 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	24	 The mechanisms that govern the level and the cell specific regulation of CFTR expression have been explored but remain poorly understood.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	25	 The putative promoter region lies within 3800 bp of the start site of CFTR transcription and supports low level expression of reporter genes in vitro (13 -16 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	26	 CFTR expression can be induced by cAMP (17 ) and suppressed by phorbol ester (18 ,19 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	27	 (20 ) demonstrated that the induction of CFTR expression by protein kinase A is mediated by an 8 bp cAMP responsive element upstream from CFTR.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	28	 (21 ) analyzed the function of an inverted CCAAT element at -132 to -119 upstream from CFTR in detail.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	29	 They showed that transcription factor binding to this element confers both basal and cAMP-induced CFTR expression.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	30	 The level of CFTR expression also appears to be related to the state of cellular differentiation (22 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	31	 Additional regulatory elements have been shown to lie within this 5'-flanking region as well as within the first CFTR intron (23 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	32	 DNase I hypersensitivity sites have been demonstrated within the 120 kb upstream of CFTR, but no correlation with cell type specific CFTR expression was observed (24 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	33	 Taken together, these studies provide little insight into the exact mechanisms that determine the level and specificity of CFTR expression.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	34	One novel approach to study CFTR expression is to introduce the entire 230 kb gene and flanking sequences into mammalian cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	35	 Obstacles to this approach include: (i) obtaining an appropriate vector containing a full-length, human CFTR without deletions, mutations or rearrangements; (ii) maintaining the integrity of CFTR during vector propagation; and (iii) transferring CFTR intact into appropriate mammalian cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	36	 Yeast artificial chromosomes (YACs) provide potential vectors for such a study.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	37	 YACs containing human CFTR were generated soon after the gene was identified (25 ,26 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	38	 Although the genetic structure of these YACs has been studied, the functionality of CFTR contained within them has not been established.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	39	The goal of the present study was to determine if two different YACs containing full-length, human CFTR and ~45 or 335 kb of adjacent upstream sequence can produce functional human cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator protein (CFTR) in mammalian cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	40	 The analyses that follow demonstrate the functionality of the human CFTR contained within each YAC.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	41	 RESULTS Human CFTR-containing YACs are used to generate stable Chinese hamster ovary cell lines.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	42	Each YAC used in this study contains full-length, human CFTR (Fig.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	43	 The neomycin resistance gene (neor) was introduced into the right arm of each YAC and the extent of human sequence surrounding CFTR was determined by restriction analysis.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	44	 The smaller YAC, yCFTR325-Neo, is ~320 kb and contains 45 kb of flanking sequence upstream from the CFTR transcriptional unit and 30 kb of 3'-flanking DNA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	45	 The larger YAC, yCFTR8-Neo, is ~620 kb and contains 335 kb of 5'-flanking and 40 kb of 3'-flanking DNA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	46	 Map of the two YACs used in this study.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	47	 yCFTR325-Neo is ~320 kb and contains 45 kb of 5'-flanking and 30 kb of 3'-flanking DNA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	48	 yCFTR8-Neo is ~620 kb and contains 335 kb of 5'-flanking and 40 kb of 3'-flanking DNA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	49	 CFTR transcription start site is indicated by the arrow.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	50	 The NruI sites in the human DNA as well as the two sites in the right YAC arm are indicated by `N'.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	51	In separate experiments, Chinese hamster ovary-K1 (CHO) cells were fused with yeast spheroplasts containing one of the two YACs.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	52	 CHO cells that incorporated neor were identified by their clonal growth in the presence of G418.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	53	 Approximately 50 colonies of CHO cells from each YAC transfer were present after 2 weeks of G418 selection.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	54	 Twenty clones derived using the smaller YAC and 27 clones derived using the larger YAC were randomly selected and sub-cultured.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	55	 Fourteen clones containing the smaller YAC and seven containing the larger YAC were randomly selected and analyzed to determine if they contained human CFTR, as described below.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	56	Screening of CHO cell clones for human CFTR was performed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) analysis of genomic DNA using two sets of intron primers, one spanning exon 2 and the other, exon 6a.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	57	 These primers were chosen toward the 5'-end of the gene since neor was located beyond the 3'-end of CFTR.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	58	 Seven out of 14 clones derived using the smaller YAC and the six out of seven clones derived from the larger YAC were positive for CFTR exons 2 and 6a.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	59	 Control CHO cell DNA was negative under identical reaction conditions.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	60	 Clones positive for both exons were analyzed for CFTR mRNA by reverse transcription (RT)-PCR using primers spanning exon 7 to exon 9.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	61	 Three out of seven clones derived using the smaller YAC and four out of six clones derived using the larger YAC were positive.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	62	 Control CHO cell RNA was negative under identical reaction conditions (data not shown).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	63	 Based on this screening, candidates were chosen for further study.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	64	 The detailed genetic and functional analyses of the two clones with the highest level of CFTR mRNA are described below.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	65	 The cell line designated CS2/C5 was derived using yCFTR325-Neo, and CS1/F2 was derived using yCFTR8-Neo.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	66	 A single site of integration is identified in each cell line.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	67	Fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) was performed on metaphase nuclei from CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 to determine the site of CFTR integration (Fig.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	68	 Using a YAC derived from y37AB12 (25 ) containing the entire CFTR as a probe, the human CFTR was localized to a single locus in each clone.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	69	 The human CFTR was integrated at CHO chromosome band 4p21-23 in the CS2/C5 cell line and at CHO chromosome band 5q27 in the CS1/F2 cell line.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	70	 FISH of metaphase nuclei hybridized with a CFTR-containing YAC probe derived from y37AB12 and labeled with SpectrumOrange.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	71	 The chromosomes were counter-stained with DAPI.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	72	 (A) yCFTR325-Neo integrated into CHO chromosome band 4p21-23 in the cell line CS2/C5.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	73	 (B) yCFTR8-Neo integrated into CHO chromosome band 5q27 in the cell line CS1/F2.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	74	 No hybridization was seen in control CHO cells (data not shown).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	75	Southern analysis was performed to determine the copy number of human CFTR incorporated into each CHO cell clone (Fig.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	76	 Genomic DNA from CS2/C5, CS1/F2, control CHO cells and HT-1080 (a pseudodiploid human fibrosarcoma cell line; ATCC CCL 121) was digested with EcoRI and hybridized to a cDNA fragment containing part of the CFTR 3'-untranslated region within exon 24.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	77	2 kb single band was seen in CS2/C5, CS1/F2 and HT-1080, but not in control CHO.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	78	 CFTR copy number was assessed by comparing the clones with HT-1080.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	79	 The intensity of the bands from 10 [mu]g of CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 DNA was similar to that obtained from 5 [mu]g of HT-1080 DNA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	80	 These data suggest that on the order of one copy of CFTR was integrated into the CHO genome in each cell line.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	81	 Similar results are shown for CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 compared with CFPAC-1 cells [a hyperdiploid human pancreatic adenocarcinoma cell line (ATCC CRL 1918)].
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	82	 Southern analysis of genomic DNA from human genomic DNA, CS2/C5, CS1/F2 and CHO cells digested with EcoRI and hybridized to a cDNA probe containing the CFTR 3'-untranslated region within exon 24.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	83	 Lane 1: 10 [mu]g of DNA from CS2/C5.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	84	 Lane 2: 10 [mu]g of DNA from CS1/F2.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	85	 Lane 3: 10 [mu]g of DNA from control CHO cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	86	 Lane 4: 5 [mu]g of DNA from human HT-1080 cells.

0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	89	 Lane 7: 10 [mu]g of DNA from human CFPAC-1.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	90	 Lane 8: 10 [mu]g of DNA from yCFTR325-Neo.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	91	 Lane 9: 10 [mu]g of DNA from yCFTR8-Neo.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	92	 Size markers are indicated in kb.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	93	 Human CFTR is integrated intact.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	94	The integrity of the human CFTR present in the CHO cell clones was assessed by Fiber-FISH (Fig.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	95	 DNA strands from both CFTR-containing clones, CHO cells and normal human peripheral blood lymphocytes (PBL) were analyzed.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	96	 The probes used to delineate human CFTR included the human CFTR-containing YAC used for FISH (Fig.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	97	 2 ) and cosmids cW44 (27 ) containing exon 1 and cf24 (a gift from Jeff Touchman and Eric Green, NIH, Bethesda, MD) containing exons 20 to 24.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	98	 The rhodamine labeled cosmids delineate the ends of the CFTR coding region and the fluorescein-labeled YAC probe extends 45 kb upstream and 30 kb downstream from the 230 kb gene.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	99	 The expected hybridization pattern was seen in PBL as well as in DNA fibers obtained from CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	100	 DNA fibers from control CHO cells did not hybridize with any of the CFTR probes.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	101	 These data not only confirm the presence of human CFTR in both clones, but suggest that the gene is grossly intact.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	102	 Fiber-FISH of DNA strands from PBL, CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	103	 (A) Diagram of the three probes used inthese experiments representing the expected lengths of fully stretched B-form DNA at the magnification used in all panels.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	104	 The CFTR-containing YAC probe was obtained from y37AB12 and labeled with fluorescein.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	105	 The cosmids containing exons 1 (cW44) and 20 to 24 (cf24) were labeled with rhodamine.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	106	 This technique does not allow for definitive orientation of fiber direction.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	107	 (B) Fiber-FISH of DNA strands derived from PBL which hybridized with all three CFTR probes.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	108	 (C) Fiber-FISH of DNA strands obtained from the cell line CS2/C5.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	109	 (D) Fiber-FISH of DNA strands obtained from the cell line CS1/F2.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	110	 No hybridization was seen in control CHO cells (data not shown).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	111	 Southern analysis of genomic DNA from human genomic DNA, CS2/C5, CS1/F2 and CHO cells digested with EcoRI and hybridized to a full-length CFTR cDNA probe.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	112	 Lane 4: DNA from human HT-1080 cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	113	Southern blot hybridization of genomic DNA from CS2/C5, CS1/F2, control CHO and human HT-1080 cells was performed to assess the integrity of the integrated CFTR (Fig.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	114	 The DNA was digested with EcoRI, separated on a 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	115	8% agarose gel and hybridized to a probe comprising the full-length, human CFTR cDNA which should hybridize to any EcoRI fragments which contain CFTR exons.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	116	 The data shows that the two clones have very similar hybridization patterns, and that the bands are nearly identical to the pattern seen in the control human DNA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	117	 The genomic DNAs from the yeast containing each YAC also have a similar hybridization pattern to the clones and to the human genomic DNA, although the faintest bands in the yeast are difficult to visualize in the mammalian cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	118	 This data suggests a high degree of integrity of the majority of the integrated human CFTR in the CHO cell lines over the 230 kb of coding sequence and is consistent with our observation of full-length CFTR mRNA and functional protein.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	119	 Human CFTR mRNA and protein are expressed in both CHO cell lines.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	120	The presence of the human CFTR mRNA was determined by Northern analysis (Fig.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	121	5 kb mRNA transcript was observed in both CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	122	 This transcript was similar in size to the CFTR mRNA produced by T84 cells which served as a positive control for CFTR expression (13 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	123	 No corresponding transcript was detected in control CHO cells or normal human airway epithelial cells (data not shown).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	124	 These results demonstrate that both CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 produce a sufficient amount of full-length, human CFTR mRNA to be detected not only by RT-PCR but by Northern analysis.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	125	The presence of human CFTR was determined by immunoprecipitation of cell lysates with an antibody to the C-terminus of CFTR, phosphorylation with [[gamma]-32P]adenosine triphosphate (ATP) and analysis by sodium dodecyl sulfate-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE) (Fig.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	126	 Both clones produced mature, glycosylated CFTR which could be phosphorylated in vitro.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	127	 A similar CFTR profile was seen in T84 cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	128	 No corresponding band was observed in the control CHO cell lysate.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	129	 The appearance of mature, human CFTR in CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 cells demonstrates that CHO cells possess the cellular machinery to not only transcribe CFTR from the introduced YAC but to translate and appropriately process the protein.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	130	 Northern analysis of total RNA from CS2/C5, CS1/F2 and control CHO cells hybridized with a CFTR cDNA probe.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	131	5 kb CFTR mRNA band is indicated by the arrow.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	132	 Lane 1: 20 [mu]g of RNA from CS2/C5 cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	133	 Lane 2: 20 [mu]g of RNA from CS1/F2 cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	134	 Lane 3: 20 [mu]g of RNA from control CHO cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	135	 Lane 4: 2 [mu]g of RNA from T84 cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	136	 SDS-PAGE of cell lysates immunoprecipitated with an antibody to CFTR and phosphorylated with [[gamma]-32P]ATP.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	137	 Mature CFTR is indicated by the arrow.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	138	 Lane 1: Control CHO cell lysate.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	139	 Autoradiograph exposure times were 50 h for lanes 1-3 and 10 h for lane 4.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	140	 Human CFTR is functional in both CHO cell lines.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	141	The function of the human CFTR produced by the CHO cell lines CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 was assessed by cAMP-stimulated 36Cl- efflux (Fig.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	142	 cAMP stimulation was provided by the addition of forskolin and non-hydrolyzable analogues of cAMP after a period of equilibration.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	143	 A significant rise in 36Cl- efflux was observed 30-60 s after cAMP stimulation in both clones (p  < 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	144	 The level of 36Cl- efflux in response to cAMP in early passage CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 cells was similar to that observed in T84 cells (p  < 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	145	 There was no analogous cAMP-stimulated 36Cl- efflux in control CHO cells or in another clonal CHO cell line (S1) derived using a 140 kb YAC containing neor and human DNA unrelated to CFTR.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	146	 In the absence of endogenous CFTR activity in CHO cells, the release of 36Cl- from the cell layer of the clones in response to cAMP indicates the presence of functional human CFTR produced from the introduced YACs.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	147	 36Cl- efflux from cells stimulated with forskolin and non-hydrolyzable cAMP analogues (cAMP cocktail).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	148	 The data is expressed as percent 36Cl- efflux per min.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	149	 (A) CS2/C5 cells in early (8th  and  9th) ([circle]), n = 12 and later passages (11th  and  12th) (-), n = 12.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	150	 (B) CS1/F2 cells in early (8th  and  9th) ([circle]), n = 12 and later passages (11th  and  12th) (-), n = 12.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	151	 (C) Control CHO cells ([squf]), n = 23 or S1 cells containing a YAC with neor but without CFTR ([squ]), n = 23, (D) T-84 cells ([utrif]), n = 12.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	152	 The level of efflux was compared to the 1 min control time point when cAMP was added: *p  < 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	153	This study describes the generation of two clonal CHO cell lines, CS2/C5 and CS1/F2, containing full-length, human CFTR.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	154	 These cell lines were derived from the fusion of CHO cells with yeast spheroplasts containing two different YACs which include human CFTR and ~75 or 375 kb of adjacent sequences.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	155	 Fluorescence in situ hybridization was performed on metaphase nuclei to indicate the site of YAC integration.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	156	 A single site of integration on a different CHO chromosome was found in each cell line.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	157	 Southern analysis suggested that each clone most likely contains on the order of one copy of human CFTR per CHO cell genome.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	158	 Fiber-FISH suggested the gross structural integrity of the transferred CFTR in both cell lines.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	159	 The integrity of the integrated CFTR was indicated further by restriction analysis of genomic DNA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	160	 These results suggested that the majority of human CFTR was grossly intact and correlated with functionalCFTR production, potentially extending the application of Fiber-FISH beyond its current status as a genetic mapping tool (28 ,29 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	161	 The Fiber-FISH also suggested that the flanking sequences common to both YACs were present in both cell lines.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	162	 Finally, the sequence-tagged site, sL12, located at the extreme 5'-end of yCFTR8-Neo (26 ) was detected in DNA from CS1/F2 cells suggesting that this larger YAC is incorporated in its entirety into the CHO genome (data not shown).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	163	The parental YACs used in these experiments were constructed several years ago (25 ,26 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	164	 Although the human CFTR contained in these YACs has been shown to be grossly intact, even after transfer into Chinese hamster fibroblasts (30 ), the functionality of the CFTR has not been established until now.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	165	 The present study demonstrates the production of full-length CFTR mRNA and functional protein by both CS2/C5 and CS1/F2.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	166	 Human CFTR production in these cell lines implies that the regulatory elements needed for gene expression are contained within these YACs.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	167	 The ability of these cells to produce mature and functional protein at the cell surface for more than 15 passages is demonstrated by cAMP-stimulated 36Cl- efflux.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	168	 CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 are distinctive from the other clonal lines generated in this study because their CFTR mRNA can be detected by both RT-PCR and Northern analysis.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	169	 None of the other cell lines created in this study and analyzed by Northern analysis have comparable mRNA transcripts.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	170	The rate of 36Cl- efflux observed in both CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 at early passages is similar to that seen in T84 cells, despite the fact that they have lower CFTR mRNA and protein levels than T84 cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	171	 This data supports previous studies in which cAMP-mediated chloride efflux was a sensitive indicator of functional protein without direct correlation with the level of CFTR expression (31 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	172	Ordinarily, YAC gene transfer is carried out in a mammalian cell line in which the gene of interest is endogenously expressed, placing the YAC into an environment likely to be permissive for the human promoter (32 -35 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	173	 In contrast, the present study demonstrates YAC-mediated gene transfer into cells lacking endogenous CFTR production (36 ,37 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	174	 It is unclear why only human CFTR appears to be functionally expressed when both the endogenous and transferred genes could potentially interact with the same basal transcription factors.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	175	 Several aspects of YAC integration may support expression of the transferred human CFTR in these CHO cell clones.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	176	 For example, it has been suggested that transferred YACs may retain a chromatin structure that favors expression (38 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	177	 CFTR expression from these YACs may be favored by the requirement that the nearby neor has to be expressed in order for the cells to survive, forcing the adjacent chromatin to remain open.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	178	 In addition, the human and hamster genes could have different affinities for DNA binding proteins.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	179	 An alternative explanation is that the hamster CFTR is mutated and cannot produce functional CFTR.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	180	 To better understand the differential expression of the hamster and human genes, it would be useful to directly compare the structure of the two genes.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	181	 However, this work remains to be done because hamster CFTR has not yet been extensively characterized.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	182	 In the present studies, full length human CFTR probes did not clearly cross hybridize with control CHO cells, suggesting there is very little homology between the hamster and human CFTR, or perhaps that the gene is absent in the control CHO line.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	183	The etiology of the unexpectedly high level of human CFTR expression in these CHO cell lines is also unclear.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	184	 Each clonal cell line produces mRNA and protein at easily detectable levels.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	185	 The FISH and Southern analysis suggest that this level of expression is likely a consequence of CFTR integrated at a unique locus in each cell line at a copy number on the order of one per CHO genome.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	186	 In contrast, when the techniques employed in the present study are applied to evaluate CFTR expression in normal diploid human epithelial cells, it is difficult to detect CFTR mRNA (10 ) or protein (S.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	187	 Cheng, Genzyme, Framingham, MA, pers.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	188	 The level of CFTR expression could be related to a number of factors including the regulatory sequences within the YAC vector, the distance the gene lies from the YAC ends and the integration site in the host genome (32 ,38 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	189	 Another potential positive influence on CFTR promoter function is the SV40 enhancer that supports neor expression.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	190	 The SV40 enhancer has been shown to augment CFTR promoter function in reporter gene constructs (15 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	191	 In addition to these factors, the liberation of the gene from a negative regulatory element, possibly downstream, in a region not included in either YAC, could result in higher than expected expression.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	192	 Other CFTR-containing YACs with additional flanking sequences are available (26 ) and could be used to address this issue.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	193	The similar levels of human CFTR expression in CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 cells suggest that the expression is independent of the site of integration.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	194	 Such position independent expression is not necessarily expected in cell lines created by YAC transfer.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	195	 It has been postulated that a buffer of DNA sequence might insulate the gene of interest from positional effects at the site of integration (32 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	196	 The extensive amount of sequence upstream from CFTR in these YACs could potentially act as a buffer and might account for the similar level of expression seen in the two different clones.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	197	 The detailed analysis of more clones derived from each YAC would be necessary to determine how any of these factors contribute to the level of human CFTR expression.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	198	This study demonstrates that the CFTR contained within the YACs used in this study are free of gross rearrangements and are functional.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	199	 Furthermore, the expression of the introduced gene indicates that sufficient sequence is present to promote human CFTR expression.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	200	 Although this is the first study investigating the function of the full-length, human CFTR contained within YACs, a limited number of studies have documented functional protein production from other human genes transferred to mammalian cells by YAC vectors (34 ,38 -42 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	201	 These cell lines often have appropriate regulation of the transferred genes and have been used to study various aspects of gene expression (38 ,39 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	202	The CFTR-containing YACs and cell lines described in this paper offer several advantages over other model systems for the study of CFTR expression.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	203	 Analysis of the role of the intron sequences and the flanking sequences contained within these CFTR-containing YACs may help to elucidate the regulation of CFTR expression in ways not possible when cell lines are created with cDNA constructs (36 ,43 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	204	 In addition, the cells in this study do not have a growth disadvantage when compared to the parental CHO cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	205	 Finally, these YACs can be manipulated in yeast to generate mutations in CFTR or modified to include reporter genes in place of human sequences.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	206	 Thus, these YACs and the cell lines derived from them should be useful tools for the study of CFTR gene expression.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	207	 MATERIALS AND METHODS Cell culture.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	208	Chinese hamster ovary K-1 cells (originally from Roger Tilley, Houston, TX) and human T84, CFPAC-1 and HT-1080 cells (American Type Culture Collection, ATCC, Rockville, MD) were grown in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (Biofluids, Rockville, MD) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (Biofluids), 100 U/ml penicillin (Gibco/BRL, Gaithersburg, MD), 100 [mu]g/ml streptomycin (Gibco/BRL) and 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	209	25 [mu]g/ml amphotericin B (Gibco/BRL) [DMEM] in a humidified incubator containing 5% CO2 at 37oC.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	210	 Yeast artificial chromosome modification and gene transfer.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	211	Two YACs previously shown to carry CFTR, y37AB12 (310 kb) (25 ) and yCF-1/8/7-R (610 kb) (26 ), were kar-crossed to the Saccharomyces cerevisiae strain YPH925 as previously described (44 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	212	 Resultant clones were retrofitted using the plasmid pRAN4 (ATCC) which carries the ADE2 gene for selection in yeast and neor expressed from the SV40 promoter for selection in mammalian cells (45 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	213	 PFGE and Southern blot analysis were used to verify that the retrofitted YAC clones contained neor and were the appropriate sizes.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	214	 The resulting YACs were 320 and 620 kb in size and were designated yCFTR325-Neo and yCFTR8- Neo, respectively.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	215	 Restriction enzyme digestion of these YACs was used to map the human genomic DNA flanking the 230 kb CFTR.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	216	Spheroplast fusion was carried out according to Huxley et al.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	217	 (40 ) with minor modifications.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	218	 Spheroplasts were fused with rapidly dividing CHO cellsby the dropwise addition of 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	219	5 ml polyethylene glycol 1500 (Boehringer Mannheim, Indianapolis, IN) containing 50 [mu]l dimethyl sulfoxide and 5 mM CaCl2.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	220	 The mixture was allowed to stand at room temperature for 1-2 min after which time 5 ml Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium was added.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	221	 The resulting cell suspension was mixed by inversion and centrifuged at 700 * g for 5 min.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	222	 The cell pellet was resuspended in DMEM and divided into four 10 cm tissue culture plates.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	223	 Forty-eight hours later the medium was removed and replaced with DMEM supplemented with 400 [mu]g activity/ml G418 (Gibco/BRL).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	224	 The medium was then changed three times weekly.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	225	 After ~2 weeks, individual colonies were observed, isolated using cloning cylinders, trypsinized and placed into 48 well plates containing DMEM supplemented with 400 [mu]g activity/ml G418.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	226	 When these cells reached confluence they were passed sequentially into 3 cm and 10 cm plates.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	227	 The S1 cell line was derived in a similar fashion using a 140 kb YAC containing neor and human DNA which was unrelated to CFTR.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	228	Genomic DNA was extracted from CS2/C5, CS1/F2, HT-1080 and control CHO cells using standard techniques.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	229	 The genomic DNA was screened by PCR using intron primers surrounding exons 2 and 6a as described by Zielenski et al.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	230	Southern analysis was performed on genomic DNA digested with EcoRI (New England Biolabs, Beverly, MA) for 3 h at 37oC.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	231	 The digested DNA was run on a 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	232	8% (w/v) agarose gel, blotted onto Nytran Plus (S and S, Keene, NH).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	233	 For copy number experiments the DNA was hybridized with a 685 bp cDNA fragment containing part of the CFTR 3'-untranslated region within exon 24; for integrity experiments the DNA was hybridized with a full length CFTR cDNA probe derived from pTG5955 (47 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	234	 These probes were labeled with [[alpha]-32P]dCTP (sp.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	235	 ~3000 mCi/mmole, Amersham, Arlington Heights, IL) using the Rediprime system (Amersham) according to the manufacturer's specifications.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	236	Yeast genomic DNA was prepared using a Puregene DNA isolation kit (Gentra Systems, Research Triangle Park, NC) according to the manufacturer's specifications.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	237	Total RNA was extracted from CS2/C5, CS1/F2, control CHO and T84 cell lines using TRIzol (Gibco/BRL) according to the manufacturer's instructions.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	238	 Screening of the RNA was performed by RT-PCR.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	239	 The RNA was treated with RNase-free DNase (Promega, Madison, WI) for 45 min at 37oC and incubated with Superscript II (Gibco/BRL) for 1 h at 42oC using random primers (Promega).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	240	 An aliquot of the resulting cDNA underwent 40 cycles of PCR using the following conditions: 94oC for 30 s, 55oC for 60 s, 72oC for 60 s.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	241	 The following primers spanning exons 7-9 were used: 5'-TGTGCTTCCCTATGCACTAAT-3' (forward) and 5'-TTAATATCTTTCAGGACAGGAG-3'(reverse).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	242	Northern analysis was performed on 20 [mu]g of total RNA derived from CS2/C5, CS1/F2, control CHO cells and 2 [mu]g of total RNA derived from T84 cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	243	 The RNA was separated using a 1.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	244	2% agarose (w/v), 1% formaldehyde (v/v) denaturing gel, transferred to Nytran (S and S) and hybridized to a CFTR cDNA probe derived from pTG5955 (47 ) labeled with [[alpha]-32P]dCTP using the Rediprime system according to the manufacturer's specifications.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	245	 Fluorescence in situ hybridization.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	246	A CFTR-containing YAC probe derived from y37AB12 (25 ) was prepared by degenerate oligonucleotide priming of PFGE purified YAC DNA for use in both FISH and Fiber-FISH analyses.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	247	 When used for metaphase FISH, the probe was labeled with SpectrumOrange-conjugated dUTP.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	248	 When used for Fiber-FISH, the probe was labeled with digoxigenin-11-dUTP (Boehringer Mannheim) and detected with a fluorescein conjugated anti-digoxigenin antibody (Oncor, Gaithersburg, MD).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	249	 Cosmid probes for Fiber-FISH were labeled by random priming with biotin-dUTP using a Bio-Prime kit and visualized with rhodamine-conjugated avidin.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	250	Metaphase FISH was carried out according to Pinkel et al.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	251	 (48 ) with minor modifications.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	252	 Metaphase spreadswere prepared from cells which were 70-80% confluent.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	253	 Each 10 cm plate of cells was incubated sequentially with 200 [mu]g ethidium bromide (Gibco/BRL) at 37oC for 1 h and 1 [mu]g colcemid (Gibco/BRL) for an additional 40 min at 37oC.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	254	 The cells were harvested with a cell scraper, washed three times with PBS, and incubated in 75 mM KCl for 30 min at 37oC.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	255	 One ml methanol/acetic acid (3:1, v/v) was added and the cells were centrifuged at 200 * g for 5 min at room temperature.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	256	 The pellet was washed at least four times with 5 ml methanol/acetic acid (3:1, v/v).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	257	 After the final wash, the pellet was resuspended in 1 ml methanol/acetic acid (3:1, v/v), dropped onto a glass slide and air-dried for 3 days prior to use.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	258	The slides containing metaphase nuclei were incubated at 37oC in 2* SSC for at least 1 h, dehydrated in an ethanol series (70-100%) and air dried, then denatured at 70oC for 2 min, dehydrated in an ice-cold ethanol series and air dried.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	259	 The CFTR-containing YAC probe described above was added to the hybridization buffer [0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	260	5 mM Tris-HCl, 50% formamide (v/v), 10% dextran sulfate (v/v)], denatured at 70oC for 5 min.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	261	 Twenty [mu]l of the denatured probe were added to each slide which was then covered with a glass cover slip and sealed with rubber cement.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	262	 These slides were placed in a humidified chamber and incubated overnight at 37oC.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	263	 The coverslip was removed and the slides were washed successively with 50% formamide (v/v), 2* SSC for 20 min at 45oC, 1* SSC for 10 min at 45oC and 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	264	 The slides were then placed in 1* phosphate-buffered detergent (PBD, Oncor) for at least 10 min at room temperature and dried between 2 sheets of 3 MM Whatman filter paper.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	265	 Fifteen [mu]l anti-fade mounting medium containing 4',6'-diamidino-2-phenylindole (DAPI, Oncor) were added and each slide was covered with a glass cover slip.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	266	 Fluorescence signals were detected using a Zeiss axiophot microscope (Carl Zeiss, Thornwood, NY) and captured with a Photometrics CH230 camera equipped with a Metachrome II extended UV CCD array and IP Lab Spectrum software (Signal Analytics, Vienna, VA).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	267	 Images were transferred to a Power Macintosh 8100/100, and the composite images were generated using Adobe Photoshop.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	268	DNA fibers were prepared for Fiber-FISH using the method of Heiskanen et al.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	269	 (49 ) with minor modifications.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	270	 Mechanical stretching of the fibers was carried out by first melting a small slice of a DNA containing agarose plug (~10-20 [mu]l).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	271	 The plug was placed in 20 [mu]l of water on a slide and allowed to melt for 2 min on a thermal block maintained at 85oC.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	272	 Water was added to compensate for evaporation during this period.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	273	 Stretching was accomplished by pulling the edge of a second microscope slide across the DNA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	274	 When no moisture was evident after air drying, the slide was immersed in 10 mM Tris-HCl, 1 mM EDTA, pH 8.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	275	0 at 70oC for 2 min to remove residual agar and non-adherent DNA.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	276	 The slide was allowed to air dry and cool for 1 min.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	277	 It was then dehydrated through an ethanol series (70%, 85%, 100%) to retain fibers through subsequent processing and further reduce non-specific binding.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	278	 Probe hybridization, washing and detection were carried out as described by Heiskanen et al.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	279	Immunoprecipitation and phosphorylation of CFTR in vitro with the catalytic subunit of protein kinase was performed as described by Cheng et al.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	280	 (50 ) with minor modifications.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	281	 In brief, CFTR was immunoprecipitated from cell lysates using a mouse monoclonal antibody to the C-terminus (Genzyme, Cambridge, MA) and incubated with 50 ng protein kinase catalytic subunit (Sigma, St.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	282	 Louis, MO) and 10 [mu]Ci [[gamma]-32P]ATP (sp.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	283	 >5000 mCi/mmole, Amersham) in 50 [mu]l 50mM Tris-HCl (pH7.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	284	5), 10 mM MgCl2 and 100 [mu]g/ml bovine serum albumin (Pentax fraction V, Miles, Kankakee, IL) at 30oC for 60 min.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	285	 The reaction was stopped by the addition of 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	286	5 ml RIPA buffer [50 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	287	15 M NaCl, 1% Triton x-100 (v/v), 1% sodium deoxycholate (w/v), and 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	288	 Samples were washed twice with RIPA buffer, and run on a 6% SDS-polyacrylamide gel.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	289	Control CHO, T84, S1 and both early passage (8th  and  9th) and later passage (14th  and  15th) CS2/C5 and CS1/F2 cells were assayed for 36Cl- efflux in response to cAMP at 37oC (51 ).
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	290	Confluent cells were assayed in 6-well plates.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	291	 The media was removed, the cell layers were washed three times with Dulbecco's PBS without calcium or magnesium (Gibco\BRL), then 1.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	292	5 ml Ringer's saline containing 2.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	293	 >3 mCi/g, Amersham) were placed on the cells.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	294	 Following a 2-3 h incubation, the cells were washed four times with 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	295	75 ml Ringer's saline to remove the excess radioactivity.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	296	 During a control period of 1 min the cell layer was washed with 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	297	75 ml Ringer's saline at 15 s intervals to determine the cells' baseline level of 36Cl-efflux.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	298	 Chloride efflux was stimulated by the addition of 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	299	75 ml Ringer's saline containing a cAMP cocktail [2.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	300	5 [mu]M forskolin (Sigma), 250 mM 8-bromo-adenosine 3':5' cyclic monophosphate (Sigma) and 250 mM 8-(4-chlorophenylthio)-adenosine 3':5' cyclic monophosphate (Sigma)] at 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	301	5, 2, 3 and 4 min after the baseline 36Cl-efflux had been determined.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	302	 The cells were then lysed with 0.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	303	5 N NaOH to determine the amount of 36Cl- remaining in the cell layer.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	304	 The samples were mixed with 5 ml CytoScint (ICN, Costa Mesa, CA) and counted in a Beckman model LS-1801 liquid scintillation counter.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	305	 The data was normalized on a per min basis.
0.4739439.9002671.html.plaintext.txt	306	 The increase in 36Cl- efflux associated with cAMP stimulation was compared to the baseline efflux at 1 min by paired t-test.

0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	0	Binding of serum response factor to cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator CArG-like elements, as a new potential CFTR transcriptional regulation pathway Celine Rene, Magali Taulan, Florence Iral, Julien Doudement, Aurore L'Honore1,2, Catherine Gerbon, Jacques Demaille3, Mireille Claustres and Marie-Catherine Romey*.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	1	Laboratoire de Genetique Moleculaire et Chromosomique, Institut Universitaire de Recherche Clinique Montpellier, France 1Laboratoire de Proliferation et Differentiation Cellulaire, Institut de Genetique Humaine Montpellier, France 2Laboratoire de Genetique Moleculaire, Institut de Recherches Cliniques de Montreal Quebec, Canada 3Centre de Sequencage Genomique, Institut de Genetique Humaine Montpellier, France.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	2	*To whom correspondence should be addressed.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	3	 Tel: +33 4 67 41 53 60; Fax: +33 4 67 41 53 65; Email: Marie-Catherine.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	4	   ABSTRACT TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   CFTR expression is tightly controlled by a complex network of ubiquitous and tissue-specific cis-elements and trans-factors.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	5	 To better understand mechanisms that regulate transcription of CFTR, we examined transcription factors that specifically bind a CFTR CArG-like motif we have previously shown to modulate CFTR expression.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	6	 Gel mobility shift assays and chromatin immunoprecipitation analyses demonstrated the CFTR CArG-like motif binds serum response factor both in vitro and in vivo.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	7	 Transient co-transfections with various SRF expression vector, including dominant-negative forms and small interfering RNA, demonstrated that SRF significantly increases CFTR transcriptional activity in bronchial epithelial cells.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	8	 Mutagenesis studies suggested that in addition to SRF other co-factors, such as Yin Yang 1 (YY1) previously shown to bind the CFTR promoter, are potentially involved in the CFTR regulation.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	9	 Here, we show that functional interplay between SRF and YY1 might provide interesting perspectives to further characterize the underlying molecular mechanism of the basal CFTR transcriptional activity.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	10	 Furthermore, the identification of multiple CArG binding sites in highly conserved CFTR untranslated regions, which form specific SRF complexes, provides direct evidence for a considerable role of SRF in the CFTR transcriptional regulation into specialized epithelial lung cells.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	11	   INTRODUCTION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Expression of the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) gene occurs in a subset of specialized cells of epithelial origin (1 to 3) and is tightly regulated both temporally and spatially (4,5).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	12	 However, no clear mechanism responsible for this regulation has yet been reported in part due to the complexity of the non-coding regions structure of the CFTR gene.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	13	Despite the absence of a TATA element, the transcription of the CFTR gene may be initiated through several discrete start sites (6,7), including those that are tissue-specific (8).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	14	 An intact CCAAT consensus is also required for accurate transcript initiation (9).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	15	 Both basal and cAMP-mediated regulation of CFTR transcription involve a weak cAMP response element (CRE) nucleotide consensus (10,11) in tandem with a consensus inverted CCAAT element or Y box (9).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	16	 In addition, CFTR transcription may be modulated by additional overlapping cis-acting elements, including a polymorphic YY1 site, located in the human minimal CFTR promoter (12).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	17	 CFTR promoter activity may be enhanced by exogenous transfected NF-B via its binding to the  to 1103 B element (13).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	18	 CFTR expression is also regulated through interactions with factors involved in remodeling of chromatin structure, such as CDP/cut and hGCN5 (14).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	19	Because none of these cis-acting elements confers tissue-specific control of CFTR expression, several studies focused on identifying potential regulatory elements that lie mainly outside the coding region.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	20	 Extensive analyses of the chromatin structure identified multiple clusters of DNase I-hypersensitive sites (DHSs) (15,16), some of which contain tissue-specific enhancer elements (17,18).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	21	 Multiple binding sites for a tissue-specific transcription factor, called HNF1, recently identified in various DHS core, modulate likewise CFTR expression (19).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	22	 Despite extensive studies, the transcriptional regulatory networks of CFTR expression remain to be unraveled.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	23	Our current model for the regulation of human CFTR expression proposes that multiple transcription factors interact with previously reported polymorphic and composite cis-acting elements encompassing a CArG-like motif (12,20).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	24	 The CArG box (CC(A/T)6GG), originally defined as the core component of the serum response element (SRE), is found in the 5' region of immediate early response genes, such as c-fos (21), and in many muscle-specific gene promoters (22).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	25	 This DNA element binds serum response factor (SRF), highly regulated and interactive transcription factor, which is phylogenetically conserved and belongs to the MADS box family of proteins, with MCM1, Agamous, Deficiens and SRF (23).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	26	 Although SRF is particularly enriched in skeletal, cardiac and smooth muscle lineages (24,25), it is also expressed in a variety of human cell lines from distinct tissue origins (26), and, to a lesser extent, in ectoderm-derived tissue such as gastric epithelium (27).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	27	 Interestingly, it has been shown that Drosophila SRF homolog is expressed in a subset of tracheal cells and regulates cytoplasmic outgrowth during terminal branching of the tracheal system (28).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	28	 Hence, it has been suggested that SRF plays an essential role in the formation of the respiratory system.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	29	 Moreover, it has been recently shown that SRF is involved in myofibroblast differentiation during lung damage (29).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	30	 Therefore, we hypothesized that trans-acting factors interacting with CArG-like motif, such as SRF, could be important in CFTR expression regulation.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	31	 We provided evidence that SRF is expressed in bronchial epithelial cell expressing endogenous CFTR protein.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	32	 Through the use of combined gel mobility shift to chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) assays, we first demonstrated that SRF protein binds, both in vitro and in vivo, the CFTR minimal promoter region spanning the CArG-like motif.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	33	 Mutagenic studies and transient co-transfections experiments showed that SRF alone is not sufficient to transactivate the CFTR gene.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	34	 Upon some mutations of the CFTR-CArG-like element, promoter activity is severely decreased, potentially implying YY1 as a co-repressor.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	35	 Given the YY1 well-defined role in the transcriptional regulation of some SRE-dependent promoters (30 to 33), we explored the putative role of YY1 on the CFTR promoter activity and demonstrated functional interplay between this factor and SRF.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	36	 Finally, by stringent in silico structural analysis, we identified additional multiple near consensus CArG sites within the highly conserved promoter and intronic regions of the CFTR gene.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	37	 We also documented the existence of SRF-containing protein complexes on numerous predicted CFTR CArG-like elements.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	38	 Taken together, the data obtained classify CFTR as a novel SRF target gene, subject to modest but significant SRF activation, and open the gate to further investigate how SRF may be involved in the regulation of CFTR gene expression.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	39	   MATERIALS AND METHODS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Cell culture Human bronchial epithelial cells, Beas2B and A549 expressing endogenous CFTR were kindly provided by Dr Marc Chanson, Department of Pediatrics, Laboratory of Clinical Investigation, Switzerland.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	40	 Beas2B and A549 cells were maintained in high glucose DMEM (4500 mg/l D-Glucose, Invitrogen Corporation) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS) (Eurobio, France) and 5 mM L-glutamine.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	41	 C2C12 myoblasts were grown in DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS and 5 mM L-glutamine.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	42	 All cell cultures, supplemented with 100 U ml to 1 penicillin and 100 mg ml to 1 streptomycin, were maintained at 37 degrees C under 5% CO2.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	43	 As positive or negative controls for the different assays, other cells used in this study included colon adenocarcinoma Caco-2 cell line (ECACC) with functional CFTR (34,35) and normal monkey kidney fibroblast-like COS-7 cell line (ATCC) which does not express CFTR (36,37); all were maintained in DMEM supplemented with FBS and were incubated in the same conditions as above.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	44	Plasmids constructs The original luciferase expression vector pGL3-Basic containing the wild-type human CFTR minimal promoter was described previously (12).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	45	 To further study the putative composite cis-acting element located at  to 108 from the major transcription initiation site of the human CFTR promoter (38), the CFTR-CArG-like motif was either mutated in a consensus CArG box or in a degenerated motif.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	46	 Mutations were introduced into the WT-pGL3 plasmid using an oligonucleotide-directed mutagenesis system (QuickChangeTMSite-Directed Mutagenesis Kit, Stratagene) according to the manufacturer's instructions.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	47	 Mutagenesis primers are depicted in Table 1.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	48	 The presence of mutations and sequence fidelity were verified by dideoxynucleotide sequencing.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	49	 For each introduced mutation the loss or the improvement of transcription factor binding activity was checked by in vitro assays.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	50	 The 3xSRE-fos TATA-luciferase reporter construct was kindly provided by R.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	51	 Hipskind, Institut de Genetique Moleculaire, Montpellier, France.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	52	 Expression vectors encoding either human wild-type SRF, the pHiv-SRF or SRF dominant-negative form deleted of an essential part of DNA-binding domain (DBD), the pHiv-DN, were generously given by D.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	53	 Trouche, Laboratoire de Biologie Moleculaire Eucaryote, Toulouse, France.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	54	 Another dominant-negative SRF mutant, pHiv-DBD, was constructed by PCR amplification of SRF fragment spanning the DBD flanked by HindIII and HincII sites to facilitate cloning into expression vector.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	55	 The PCR was performed using pHiv-DBD-SRF primers (listed in Table 1), 10 ng of SRF expression vector, 200  microM of each dNTP, 0.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	56	5 U Taq DNA polymerase (Perkin Elmer, Inc.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	57	) in a 1x reaction buffer provided by the manufacturer.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	58	 TranSilent human control siRNA vector and TranSilentTM human SRF siRNA vector (catalog no.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	59	 SR1038) were purchased from Panomics.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	60	 Expression vectors encoding either pCMV-YY1 or pcDNA3-YY1 were generously provided by E.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	61	View this table:    Table 1 Sequences of oligonucleotides.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	62	  Transient transfections Cells were seeded at a density of 200 000 cells/2 ml of medium and plated in 6-well dishes (NUNClone , Merck-Eurolab, Inc.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	63	 After a culturing period of 24 h, cells were transfected with PolyFect  transfection reagent (Qiagen Corporation, France) according to the manufacturer's recommendations.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	64	 For transient transfection, we used 1.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	65	8  microg of plasmid reporter and 0.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	66	2  microg of internal control pRL-SV40 containing Renilla luciferase (Promega Corporation).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	67	 The pGL3-Basic vector lacking both eukaryotic promoter and enhancer sequences was used as a negative control.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	68	 After 48 h, the luciferase activity was evaluated with the Dual Luciferase Reporter Assay System (Promega Corporation), as described previously (12).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	69	 Luminescence measurements were performed on a Luminoskan Ascent luminometer (ThermoLabsystem Corporation, France).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	70	 Firefly luciferase activity was normalized to Renilla luciferase activity.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	71	 All luciferase activities represent at least three independent experiments with each construct tested in triplicate per experiment.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	72	 Luciferase activity data are expressed as the means  plus or minus  SD computed from the results obtained from each set of transfection experiments.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	73	 To minimize the possibility of errors in DNA amplification, at least two independently constructed clones were tested.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	74	 For co-transfection assays, unless otherwise indicated, 1.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	75	8  microgof luciferase reporter and 1 to 2  microg of each expression vector were used.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	76	 Transfection with siRNA was performed using Lipofectamine 2000 (Invitrogen) with 2.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	77	 The cells were transfected with CFTR promoter plasmid reporter, and luciferase activity was determined as described above.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	78	 Aliquots of cell lysates were used for western blotting to confirm the specificity and level of SRF protein knockdown.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	79	Preparation of whole cell proteins, nuclear extracts and recombinant protein production For the CFTR immunodetection analyses, Beas2B, A549, C2C12, COS-7 and Caco-2 cells were treated with 5 mM sodium phenylbutyrate, which has been previously reported to increase CFTR (39) and scraped into lysis buffer (50 mM Tris to HCl, 1% NP-40, 40 mM beta-glycerophosphate and 120 mM NaCl) supplemented with protease inhibitors [1 mM phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride (PMSF), 1 mM DTT, and 1  microg/ microl aprotinin, leupeptin and pepstatin].
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	80	 Nuclear extracts were prepared using the Nuclear extraction kit according to the procedure recommended by the supplier (Panomics, Ozyme, France).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	81	 Protein concentrations were determined using the Bio-Rad Protein Assay kit with BSA as a standard, based on the classical Bradford method.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	82	 The pGEX-SRF plasmid, a generous gift from D.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	83	 Trouche (Laboratoire de Biologie Moleculaire Eucaryote), was used for protein expression.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	84	 GST to SRF fusion protein was purified from Escherichia coli as described previously (40).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	85	 The purity and concentration of protein samples were estimated by SDS to PAGE.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	86	Electrophoretic mobility shift assay (EMSA) and supershifts Oligonucleotides probes were synthesized corresponding to CFTR CArG-like element and mutant versions in which the CArG motif was either mutated in a consensus box or disrupted.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	87	 The oligonucleotide sequences were listed in Table 2.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	88	 Single-stranded complementary oligonucleotides containing the studied sequences were annealed, end-labeled with [-32P]ATP (5000 Ci/mmol) and purified as described previously (12).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	89	 Mobility assay conditions were specifically optimized for binding of SRF.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	90	 The binding reaction was carried out in a total volume of 20  microl containing 2 ng (30 000 c.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	91	) of the labeled probe, 10  microl of binding buffer (2x), 0.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	92	25  microg poly(dI to dC) (Amersham Pharmacia) used as a non-specific competitor, 5 to 12  microg of nuclear extracts and 100 to 1000 ng of GST to SRF fusion chimera protein.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	93	 For EMSA competition and antibody interference assays, proteins were incubated with either cold specific competitors (WT and SRE oligonucleotides, see Table 2), unspecific competitor (GATA oligonucleotide, see Table 2) or purified antibodies (anti-SRF: sc-335X; anti-YY1: sc-1703X or anti-HA, Santa Cruz, Biotechnology Inc.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	94	, TEBU, France) for 20 min before addition of labeled probes.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	95	 After incubation of 30 min at room temperature, complexes were resolved on 5% acrylamide:bisacrylamide (29:1) native gel containing 0.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	96	View this table:    Table 2 Ologonuc leotides used in EMSA analysis.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	97	  Formaldehyde cross-linking and chromatin immunoprecipitation Beas2B and A549 cells proteins were cross-linked to DNA by adding formaldehyde to a final concentration of 1% for 10 min at 37 degrees C.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	98	 The fixed cells were prepared for immunoprecipitation using the protocol of ChIP assay kit (Upstate Biotechnology Inc.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	99	, Euromedex, France) with minor modifications.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	100	 Cells were resuspended in 1 ml cold phosphate-buffered saline (PBS), pelleted by centrifugation and lysed in 800  microl of SDS lysis buffer (1% SDS, 10 mM EDTA, 50 mM Tris to HCl, pH 8.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	101	1) containing protease inhibitors (1 mM PMSF, 1  microg/mlaprotinin and 1  microg/ml pepstatinA).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	102	 After incubation on ice for 10 min, the cross-linked chromatin was sheared by sonication at the following conditions eight times for 10 s at 40% of maximum power and diluted 10-fold in ChIP dilution buffer (0.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	103	1 and 167 mM NaCl) with protease inhibitors.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	104	 Aliquots containing 20  microl of each aliquot were used as a control to show total input DNA.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	105	 The chromatin solution was precleared with 80  microl of salmon sperm DNA/protein A agarose-50% slurry (Upstate Biotechnology Inc.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	106	) for 1 h at 4 degrees C under agitation, and subsequently incubated at 4 degrees C on a rotating stand overnight with either 3  microl of anti-SRF antibody (sc-335X, Santa Cruz, Biotechnology Inc.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	107	) or an irrelevant antibody (anti-HA).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	108	 Immune complexes were precipitated by the addition of 60  microl of salmon sperm DNA/protein A agarose and incubated at 4 degrees C for 1 h and low speed spinning.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	109	 Precipitates were washed once with 1 ml of low salt buffer, once with high salt buffer, once with LiCl buffer and twice with 1x TE, according to the manufacturer's recommendations (Upstate Biotechnology Inc.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	110	 The cross-links were reversed by the addition of 20  microl of 5 M NaCl and incubation at 65 degrees C overnight.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	111	 The samples were treated with proteinase K, phenol to chloroform extracted, ethanol precipitated and resuspended in 30  microl of sterile water.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	112	 PCR analysis was carried out using primers from different regions of the human CFTR promoter and as additional controls from promoter regions of a number of genes that are either silent (ss-globin) or having at least one functional CArG element (ss-actin).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	113	 The sequences of PCR primers are listed in Table 1.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	114	 After 45 cycles of amplification, PCR products were separated on 1.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	115	8% agarose gels and visualized by ethidium bromide staining and UV transillumination.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	116	Reverse transcriptase to PCR Total RNA from epithelial cells (Beas2B and A549), myoblasts (C2C12) and fibroblasts (COS-7) was isolated using the SV Total RNA Isolation System  (Promega, France).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	117	 Reverse transcription was performed with 3  microg of total RNA, 300 ng of random hexamers (Invitrogen Corporation), 10 mM dNTPs, 1  microl of RNasin RNase inhibitor (Promega), 2  microl of DTT at 0.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	118	1 M, 4  microl of first strand buffer (Invitrogen), 200 U of M-MLV RT (Invitrogen) and nuclease-free water (Promega) in a final reaction volume of 20  microl.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	119	 For each RNA template, a control reaction without RT was included.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	120	 For each RT reaction condition, an H2O no-template reaction was included as an additional negative control.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	121	 The reaction mixture was incubated first for 10 min at 25 degrees C, then 40 min at 42 degrees C; this was followed by a heat inactivation step of 72 degrees C for 3 min.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	122	 Aliquots containing 1  microl of the cDNA synthesis reaction mixture were used for PCR analyses.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	123	 The expression level of SRF mRNA was analyzed by PCR amplification of the endogenous Hypoxanthine PhosphoRybosyl-Transferase (HPRT) gene used as internal control.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	124	 Amplification mixture included either 10 pmol of each SRF-specific primer or 10 pmol of each HPRT-specific primer, 1.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	125	5 U of AmpliTaq polymerase (Applied Biosystem Corporation) and nuclease-free water (Promega) in a 25  microl volume.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	126	 Amplification was performed with an initial denaturation step at 95 degrees C for 5 min, followed by 35 cycles of 30 s of 95 degrees C denaturation, 60 s of 52 degrees C annealing and 2 min extension at 72 degrees C.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	127	 Amplification of CFTR was performed as described previously (41).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	128	 The RT to PCR products were separated on an 8% non-denaturing polyacrylamide gel, stained with ethidium bromide.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	129	 To ensure that the sequence of cDNA products derived from both SRF and CFTR RT to PCR analyses correspond to respective published sequences, the cDNA bands were purified and prepared for dideoxy DNA sequencing.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	130	 Controls included RNA preparations from monkey kidney fibroblasts (COS-7), which are negative for CFTR expression (36,37).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	131	Western blot analysis Twenty-five microgram protein extracts (except where otherwise indicated) were resolved on a 10% (except where otherwise indicated) SDS to polyacrylamide gel and transferred onto a nitrocellulose membrane (except where otherwise indicated).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	132	 All membranes were Ponceau S stained to ensure sample integrity.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	133	 Briefly, the membranes were blocked with 5% skim milk in PBS supplemented with 0.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	134	01% Tween-20 and incubated with diluted primary antibodies in 5% skim milk (1:5000 diluted anti-SRF Abs: sc-335X and sc-25290X purchased from Santa Cruz; 1:1000 diluted anti-CFTR Ab: 24.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	135	1 from R and D System; 1:2500 diluted anti-ss-actin antibody: AC-15 from Sigma, 1:2500 diluted anti-ss-tubulin antibody: T6074 from Sigma) overnight.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	136	 The membranes were then washed and incubated with an appropriate horseradish peroxidase (HRP) conjugated secondary antibody at 1:15 000 in PBS-5% milk.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	137	 The membranes were reacted with chemiluminescence reagent ECL (Roche Diagnostic) as described by the manufacturer and subsequently exposed to Biomax photographic film (Kodak Corporation).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	138	 The protein levels of the actin housekeeping gene (except where otherwise stated) were assayed for internal control of protein loading.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	139	Indirect immunofluorescence A549, Beas2B, C2C12 and COS-7 cells were plated on Lab-TekTMII CC2TM Chamber SlideTM systems (Nalge Nunc) 1 day before immunohistochemical analysis.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	140	 The cells were fixed and permeabilized in 4% paraformaldehyde and 0.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	141	1% Triton X-100, respectively, for 20 min durations at room temperature.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	142	 Non-specific binding sites were blocked with 1% BSA in PBS for 1 h.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	143	 The cells were subsequently incubated with primary antibodies diluted in 1:100 in PBS to BSA.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	144	 Antibodies used included, the clone L12B4 (Upstate biotechnology), an anti-CFTR antibody known to recognize human, rat, mouse and bovine CFTRs (42) and the H-300 or the A11 anti-SRF antibody (sc-13029 and sc-25290, Santa Cruz).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	145	 The specificity of the anti-CFTR antibody has been described previously (43,44) and was also verified by using a CFTR-positive human Caco-2 cell line (34,35).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	146	 For nuclear counterstaining, DAPI (sc-3598, Santa Cruz) was applied at a concentration of 1:5000.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	147	 Cells were then washed with PBS to BSA and incubated with either donkey anti-rabbit fluorescein isothiocyanate-conjugated (FITC) or donkey anti-mouse Cy3TM conjugated secondary antibody (Jackson ImmunoResearch Laboratory Inc.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	148	) diluted 1:200 for 1 h at room temperature.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	149	 Cells were washed twice with PBS to BSA, once with PBS, and mounted with Dakocytomation fluorescent mounting medium (Dakocytomation).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	150	 Indirect immunofluorescence was examined with an inverted Leica DMR microscope (Leica Microsystemes SAS).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	151	 Final images were further processed using Adobe Photoshop 7.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	152	Statistical analyses Transfection data are expressed as the mean  plus or minus  SE.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	153	 Paired comparisons were made using student's t-test.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	154	 Data were considered statistically significant at P  <  0.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	155	 All graphical data and statistical analyses were generated with GraphPAD Prism software (Version 3.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	156	 Densitometric analysis was performed using computerized densitometry and ImageQuantTL v.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	157	0 software (Amersham Biosciences).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	158	 Densitometric values for both transcript and protein bands were determined in areas of equal size and are reported in normalized arbitrary units relatives to the expression of either HPRT gene or actin protein set to 1 (except where otherwise indicated).
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	159	Computational analyses The computer program ConSite (http://www.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	160	org/), particularly suited to the analysis of large genomic sequences, was used to identify putative CArG binding sites within the promoter and intronic regions of the human CFTR gene.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	161	com/) was then used to verify these predictions and minimize false negatives or positives.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	162	 To prevent a possible bias introduced by palindromic or internally repetitive cis-regulatory elements, overlapping matches, including on opposite DNA strands, were defined as a single match.
0.44163495.16170155.html.plaintext.txt	163	To assess the importance of the putative CArG elements identified in the non-coding regions of the human CFTR gene, we performed multiple sequence alignments.
