0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	0	RAPID COMMUNICATION Glutathione permeability of CFTR Paul Linsdell and John W.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	1	Department of Physiology, McGill University, Montreal, Quebec, Canada H3G 1Y6.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	2	    ABSTRACT Top Abstract Introduction Methods Results Discussion References.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	3	The cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) forms an ion channel that is permeable both to Cl and to larger organic anions.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	4	 Here we show, using macroscopic current recording from excised membrane patches, that the anionic antioxidant tripeptide glutathione is permeant in the CFTR channel.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	5	 This permeability may account for the high concentrations of glutathione that have been measured in the surface fluid that coats airway epithelial cells.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	6	 Furthermore, loss of this pathway for glutathione transport may contribute to the reduced levels of glutathione observed in airway surface fluid of cystic fibrosis patients, which has been suggested to contribute to the oxidative stress observed in the lung in cystic fibrosis.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	7	 We suggest that release of glutathione into airway surface fluid may be a novel function of CFTR.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	8	cystic fibrosis; chloride channel; lung defense; airway surface fluid; multidrug resistance protein ; cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	9	    INTRODUCTION Top Abstract Introduction Methods Results Discussion References.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	10	CYSTIC FIBROSIS (CF) is caused by mutations in a single gene: the one that encodes the CF transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	11	 CFTR, which is a member of the "ATP-binding cassette" (ABC) family of membrane transport proteins, forms a phosphorylation- and ATP-dependent Cl channel (3, 4).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	12	 It remains unclear how the reduced epithelial Cl permeability caused by the functional absence of CFTR leads to the complexity of symptoms seen in CF lung disease.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	13	 This, coupled with the structural similarity between CFTR and other ABC proteins, has long hinted that CFTR may also perform some other function.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	14	The anionic tripeptide glutathione (-glutamyl-cysteinyl-glycine; GSH) is the most important extracellular antioxidant in the lung (1, 20).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	15	 Airway surface fluid (ASF) contains ~400  microM GSH, ~50 times the concentration found in plasma and 100 times that found in the extracellular fluid of many other tissues (1, 5, 17, 20).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	16	 The source of the high concentration of GSH found in ASF is unknown (20).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	17	 Interestingly, the concentration of GSH in ASF is greatly reduced in CF (16), which may exacerbate the severe oxidative stress that results from chronic inflammation of the CF lung (19).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	18	    Indeed, antioxidant therapy for CF has previously been suggested (2, 16, 19).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	19	Recently we demonstrated that a broad range of large organic anions were able to permeate through the CFTR Cl channel from the cytoplasmic side of the membrane, and we suggested that release of such anions into ASF might be a novel physiological function of CFTR (11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	20	 Here we show that both GSH and oxidized glutathione (GSSG) can permeate through CFTR from the intracellular solution.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	21	 These results suggest that CFTR, in addition to its role as a Cl channel, may function as a permeation pathway by which GSH is released into ASF.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	22	 Such a function would suggest a previously unidentified link between CFTR and lung antioxidant defense.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	23	 Loss of this GSH permeation pathway may contribute to the pathogenesis of CF.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	24	    METHODS Top Abstract Introduction Methods Results Discussion References.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	25	Macroscopic CFTR current recordings were carried out on inside-out membrane patches excised from baby hamster kidney cells stably expressing CFTR, as described in detail elsewhere (9, 11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	26	 Briefly, channels were activated by exposure of the cytoplasmic face of excised patches to 40-60 nM protein kinase A catalytic subunit (PKA) plus 1 mM MgATP.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	27	 All current traces shown have had the background leak current, recorded before addition of PKA, digitally subtracted, as described previously (9, 11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	28	 Current traces were filtered at 100 Hz using an eight-pole Bessel filter, digitized at 250 Hz and analyzed using pCLAMP6 computer software (Axon Instruments, Foster City, CA).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	29	Recording solutions contained (in mM) 150 NaCl, 2 MgCl2, 10 TES, or 154 NaGSH or Na2GSSG plus 2 Mg(OH)2 and 10 TES.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	30	 All solutions were adjusted to pH 7.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	31	 Where the pipette solution did not contain Cl, the pipette Ag-AgCl wire was protected by an NaCl-containing agar bridge inside the pipette.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	32	 Voltages were corrected for measured liquid junction potentials of up to 12 mV existing between dissimilar pipette and bath solutions.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	33	 All chemicals were obtained from Sigma (St.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	34	 Louis, MO) except 4,4'-dinitrostilbene-2,2'-disulfonic acid (DNDS; Pfaltz  and  Bauer, Waterbury, CT) and glibenclamide (glyburide; Calbiochem, La Jolla, CA).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	35	Macroscopic current-voltage (I-V) relationships were constructed using depolarizing voltage ramp protocols as described previously (9, 11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	36	 The current reversal potential, Erev, was estimated by fitting a polynomial function to the I-V relationship and was used to estimate permeability (P) ratios according to the equations (1) (2) where F is the Faraday constant, R is the gas constant, and T is temperature.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	37	Block of CFTR Cl current by GSH and GSSG was analyzed using the Woodhull model of voltage-dependent block (21) (3) where i is the amplitude of the current remaining in the presence of blocker, i0 is the control, unblocked current amplitude, [B] is the blocker concentration, V is the membrane potential, and Kd(V) is the voltage-dependent dissociation constant, the voltage dependence of which is given by (4) where z' is the apparent valence of the blocking ion.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	38	Experiments were carried out at room temperature (21-23 degrees C).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	39	 Values are presented as means  plus or minus  SE.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	40	    RESULTS Top Abstract Introduction Methods Results Discussion References.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	41	A broad range of large organic anions are able to carry current through CFTR when present in the intracellular solution (11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	42	 PKA-stimulated I-V relationships obtained with GSH (Fig.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	43	 1B) in the intracellular solution and Cl in the extracellular solution (bi-ionic conditions) indicated that both of these large anions were permeant in CFTR, with mean permeabilities (according to Eqs.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	44	 1D) were measurably permeant when present in the extracellular solution under bi-ionic conditions.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	45	 This asymmetric permeability is similar to that which we previously observed with a number of other large organic anions (11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	46	 This asymmetry is abolished by substances that "lock" CFTR channels in the open state, such as pyrophosphate (PPi) (11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	47	 1, C and D, addition of 10 mM PPi to the intracellular solution stimulated the influx of GSH and GSSG from the extracellular solution.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	48	 All of these properties of GSH and GSSG permeation are similar to those we described previously for a number of different large organic anions (11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	49	 As discussed in more detail elsewhere (11), the reasons for the disruption of asymmetric permeability caused by PPi are not currently known but may involve inhibition of ATP hydrolysis-dependent transitions between different channel open states.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	50	 The mean relative permeability of GSH and GSSG under different conditions, calculated according to Eqs.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	51	 1 and 2 (see METHODS), are summarized in Fig.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	52	 Note that the permeability of the divalent anion GSSG is very low compared with GSH and other large monovalent anions (Fig.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	53	View larger version (23K):    Fig.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	54	   Asymmetric glutathione (GSH) and oxidized glutathione (GSSG) permeation in cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	55	 A-D: example current-voltage (I-V) relationships recorded with either GSH or GSSG present in intracellular or extracellular solution under bi-ionic conditions, as stated on each individual panel.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	56	 CFTR currents were consistently much smaller with intracellular GSSG than under any of the other ionic conditions studied; reasons for this are unknown.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	57	 I-V relationships such as those shown in A-D were used to calculate mean permeabilities for GSH (E) and GSSG (F), when present in intracellular solution (In) or extracellular solution (Out) under bi-ionic conditions.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	58	 Numbers in parentheses are number of patches examined.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	59	 Permeability ratios shown for GSH and GSSG in extracellular solution in absence of pyrophosphate (PPi) are maximum values, since no reversal potential was observed under these conditions over voltage range studied.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	60	 Actual permeabilities under these conditions are likely to be considerably lower; they may be zero (see Ref.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	61	The suggestion that intracellular large organic anions were permeant in CFTR and not simply transported by some CFTR-regulated transport process was supported by the finding that currents carried by such large anions were inhibited by the CFTR open-channel blockers DNDS and glibenclamide (11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	62	 Both DNDS and glibenclamide also blocked the current carried by intracellular GSH under bi-ionic conditions (Fig.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	63	 This suggests that GSH and Cl share a common permeation pathway through CFTR, as previously suggested for other large anions (11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	64	View larger version (14K):    Fig.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	65	   Blocker sensitivity of GSH efflux.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	66	 Typical examples of I-V relationships recorded under bi-ionic conditions (intracellular GSH, extracellular Cl) before (control) and immediately after addition of 200  microM 4,4'-dinitrostilbene-2,2'-disulfonate (DNDS; n = 4 patches) or 60  microM glibenclamide (Glib; n = 3 patches) to intracellular solution.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	67	If GSH and GSSG are able to permeate through the CFTR Cl channel pore, then they might also be expected to act as open channel blockers of CFTR Cl current.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	68	 Indeed, the large organic anions gluconate and glutamate, both of which are permeant in CFTR when present in the intracellular solution (11), are also low-affinity blockers of Cl permeation through the channel (10).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	69	 3, addition of GSH (5 mM) or GSSG (10 mM) to the intracellular solution reduced the macroscopic CFTR Cl current recorded with 150 mM NaCl present on both sides of the membrane.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	70	 Block by intracellular GSH and GSSG was immediate and readily reversible, consistent with an open channel block mechanism.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	71	 Analysis of the blocking effects of GSH and GSSG using the Woodhull model (21; see METHODS) suggested Kd(0) = 15.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	72	02 (n = 5) for GSH and Kd(0) = 23.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	73	 Thus, although the affinity of channel block by these two anions is relatively low, it is at least 20 times higher than that estimated for intracellular gluconate or glutamate ions at a membrane potential of 0 mV (~600 and 1,100 mM, respectively; Ref.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	74	 The ability of intracellular GSH and GSSG to act as blockers of CFTR Cl current is consistent with their being able to enter the pore from the intracellular end.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	75	View larger version (12K):    Fig.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	76	   Block of CFTR Cl currents by GSH and GSSG.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	77	 Example I-V relationships recorded with symmetrical Cl-containing solutions, before (control) and immediately after addition of 5 mM GSH or 10 mM GSSG to the intracellular solution.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	78	    DISCUSSION Top Abstract Introduction Methods Results Discussion References.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	79	Despite early skepticism due to its structure, CFTR has been conclusively proven to be a Cl channel.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	80	 Reduced transepithelial Cl transport is thought to be the primary defect in CF (15); however, the link between this reduced Cl permeability and the pathogenesis of CF lung disease remains unclear.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	81	 Previously, we suggested that CFTR may fulfill another direct transport role, allowing efflux of a broad range of large organic anions from the cytoplasm (11).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	82	 Based on our present results, we propose that a potential physiological substrate for this transport pathway is the important antioxidant molecule GSH.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	83	 The ability of GSH to permeate through CFTR suggests a direct link between CFTR and antioxidant defense in the lung.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	84	GSH is synthesized in the cytoplasm, where levels of 1-10 mM are typical (17).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	85	 High concentrations of GSH (~400  microM) are also found in ASF of healthy individuals (1).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	86	 We propose that GSH may be released into ASF via CFTR, further emphasizing the role of CFTR in determining ASF composition (18).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	87	 Because cytoplasmic concentrations of GSH are so high, a passive permeation pathway would presumably be sufficient to mediate release of such amounts of GSH into ASF.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	88	 Loss of this GSH transport pathway may contribute to CF lung disease.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	89	 The levels of GSH are greatly reduced in ASF of CF patients (16), potentially exacerbating the oxidant stress that results from neutrophil-dominated inflammation of the CF lung (16, 19).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	90	 GSH levels in ASF are also reduced in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and adult respiratory distress syndrome and are increased in cigarette smokers with no clinical evidence of lung disease (16).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	91	GSH and GSSG transport by CFTR suggests a functional similarity between CFTR and the structurally related ABC proteins, multidrug resistance protein (MRP) and canalicular multispecific organic anion transporter (cMOAT; also known as MRP2).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	92	 Both MRP and cMOAT mediate ATP-dependent export of large intracellular organic anions, in particular glutathione-S-conjugates (6, 14).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	93	 GSSG is a substrate for both MRP- and cMOAT-mediated transport (8, 14).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	94	 Unconjugated GSH may be transported by cMOAT (14) but is thought not to be transported by MRP (8); however it may act as a cosubstrate for MRP-mediated transport of unconjugated compounds (12, 13).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	95	 Potential functional overlap between CFTR and other ABC proteins is of particular interest, since it has been suggested that MRP may be able to functionally substitute for CFTR in the lung and alleviate CF symptoms (7).
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	96	 Our results suggest that such functional substitution may be due to restoration of GSH or GSH-conjugate transport.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	97	We thank Jie Liao for maintaining the cell cultures and Drs.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	98	 Elizabeth Cowley and David Eidelman for their comments on the manuscript.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	99	This work was supported by the Canadian Cystic Fibrosis Foundation (CCFF), Canadian Medical Research Council (MRC), and National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	100	 Linsdell is a CCFF postdoctoral fellow.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	101	The costs of publication of this article were defrayed in part by the payment of page charges.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	102	 The article must therefore be hereby marked "advertisement" in accordance with 18 U.
0.46872106.9688865.html.plaintext.txt	103	  1734 solely to indicate this fact.

0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	0	The Cystic Fibrosis Transmembrane Conductance Regulator Is Regulated by a Direct Interaction with the Protein Phosphatase 2A* William R.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	1	 Thelin, Mehmet Kesimer, Robert Tarran , Silvia M.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	2	From the Department of Cell and Developmental Biology, Department of Biochemistry and Biophysics, and  Cystic Fibrosis/Pulmonary Research and Treatment Center, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, Chapel Hill, North Carolina 27599.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	3	Received for publication, July 6, 2005 , and in revised form, September 23, 2005.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	4	   ABSTRACT TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   The cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) is a cAMP-activated chloride channel expressed at the apical surface of epithelia.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	5	 Although the regulation of CFTR by protein kinases is well documented, channel deactivation by phosphatases is not well understood.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	6	 We find that the serine/threonine phosphatase PP2A can physically associate with the CFTR COOH terminus.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	7	 PP2A is a heterotrimeric phosphatase composed of a catalytic subunit and two divergent regulatory subunits (A and B).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	8	 The cellular localization and substrate specificity of PP2A is determined by the unique combination of A and B regulatory subunits, which can give rise to at least 75 different enzymes.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	9	 By mass spectrometry, we identified the exact PP2A regulatory subunits associated with CFTR as A and B' and find that the B' subunit binds CFTR directly.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	10	 PP2A subunits localize to the apical surface of airway epithelia and PP2A phosphatase activity co-purifies with CFTR in Calu-3 cells.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	11	 In functional assays, inhibitors of PP2A block rundown of basal CFTR currents and increase channel activity in excised patches of airway epithelia and in intact mouse jejunum.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	12	 Moreover, PP2A inhibition in well differentiated human bronchial epithelial cells results in a CFTR-dependent increase in the airway surface liquid.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	13	 Our data demonstrate that PP2A is a relevant CFTR phosphatase in epithelial tissues.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	14	 Our results may help reconcile differences in phosphatase-mediated channel regulation observed for different tissues and cells.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	15	 Furthermore, PP2A may be a clinically relevant drug target for CF, which should be considered in future studies.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	16	   INTRODUCTION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Cystic fibrosis (CF)2 is an autosomal lethal disease characterized by abnormal ion transport in epithelial tissues.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	17	 CF is caused by mutations in the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR), an apical membrane chloride channel.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	18	 The regulation of CFTR by the cAMP-dependent protein kinase (PKA) and other protein kinases has been extensively documented.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	19	 PKA can phosphorylate the CFTR regulatory domain (R domain) on at least 11 serine residues (1-3).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	20	 In vivo, PKA phosphorylation increases CFTR open probability and the number of channels in the plasma membrane (4, 5).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	21	 Work from our laboratory and others has demonstrated that PKA and other regulatory proteins are compartmentalized in close proximity to CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	22	 The cellular machinery capable of generating cAMP, including the adenosine receptor and membrane-bound adenylate cyclase are present with CFTR in apical membrane patches (6).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	23	 A kinase-anchoring proteins (AKAPs) target PKA to protein complexes with CFTR (7-9), and the disruption of the PKA/AKAP interaction abolishes the ability of PKA to activate CFTR in response to physiologic stimuli (9).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	24	 In addition, the phosphodiesterase PDE4D is also present with CFTR in patch preparations and forms a cAMP diffusion barrier at the apical plasma membrane (10).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	25	 Other CFTR regulatory molecules including protein kinase C and the AMP-activated protein kinase are found in protein complexes associated directly with CFTR (11, 12).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	26	Less is known about the ability of serine/threonine phosphatases to regulate CFTR activity or how they are compartmentalized with CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	27	 Work from many laboratories suggests that multiple phosphatases, including PP2A, PP2B, PP2C, and alkaline phosphatase, are involved in the deactivation of CFTR (13-17).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	28	 In vitro, PP2A and PP2C are most effective in dephosphorylating purified CFTR and recombinant R domain.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	29	 Furthermore, exogenous PP2A and PP2C inactivate CFTR in excised membrane patches (13, 18).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	30	 In human sweat ducts, cardiac myocytes, 3T3 fibroblasts, and Hi-5 insect cells, inhibitors of PP2A increase CFTR channel activity (14, 16, 18, 19).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	31	 Likewise, PP2B inhibitors stimulate CFTR in NIH 3T3 fibroblasts (17).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	32	 However, the contribution of PP2A and PP2B to CFTR deactivation may vary in different cell types (15, 20).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	33	 In baby hamster kidney cells, PP2C co-immunoprecipitates with exogenously expressed CFTR (20).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	34	 Additionally, PP2C overexpression in Fischer rat thyroid cells decreases CFTR chloride conductance (15).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	35	 However, the ability of endogenous PP2C to regulate CFTR in native epithelial tissues is unclear, since no PP2C inhibitors have been identified.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	36	 To date, no single phosphatase has been demonstrated to be both necessary and sufficient to completely down-regulate CFTR channel activity, suggesting that CFTR is dephosphorylated by multiple phosphatases.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	37	 Here, we present evidence for a direct interaction between CFTR and the serine/threonine phosphatase PP2A.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	38	 This interaction involves the COOH terminus of CFTR and the PP2A B' regulatory subunit.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	39	 PP2A localizes to the apical cell surface, where it negatively regulates CFTR channel activity in Calu-3 cells and intact mouse jejunum.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	40	 Furthermore, inhibition of PP2A increases the airway surface liquid in primary human bronchial epithelial (HBE) cells by a mechanism requiring CFTR channel activity.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	41	 We conclude that PP2A is indeed a relevant CFTR phosphatase in epithelial tissues.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	42	   EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Cell Culture and Immunofluorescence Calu-3 cells were maintained as described previously (21).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	43	 Human airway epithelial cells were obtained from freshly excised bronchial specimens from normal subjects by protease digestion, seeded directly as primary cultures on 12-mm Transwell Col membranes (T-Col; Costar) in modified BEGM media under ALI conditions, and studied when fully differentiated (3-5 weeks).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	44	 Cultures with transepithelial resistances (Rt)  >  300 ohms cm2 were studied.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	45	 Immunofluorescence and confocal microscopy were performed as described previously using anti-PP2A subunit antibodies (22).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	46	 Monoclonal anti-catalytic subunit, monoclonal anti-A regulatory subunit, and polyclonal anti-B' subunit were acquired from Upstate%20Biotechnology">Upstate Biotechnology, Inc.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	47	Affinity Purification of CFTR-interacting Proteins Peptides corresponding to residues 1375-1401, 1411-1441, 1451-1476, and 1471-1480 of human CFTR synthesized with an N-terminal biotin tag (Genemed Synthesis) were resuspended in 50 mM Tris-Cl (pH 7.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	48	 20 nmol of the peptides were immobilized on 100  microl of streptavidin-agarose (Sigma) and incubated with Calu-3 cell lysates.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	49	 Lysates were prepared by incubating twenty 100-mm dishes of Calu-3 cells in binding buffer (50 mM Tris-Cl, 150 mM NaCl, 0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	50	2% CHAPS, and protease (Roche Applied Science) and phosphatase (Sigma) inhibitor mixtures) at 4  degrees C for 1 h.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	51	 Following ultracentrifugation, the soluble fraction was precleared over empty streptavidin beads and incubated with CFTR peptides conjugated to streptavidin beads for 1 h.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	52	 The bound fractions were washed extensively in binding buffer, eluted with 5% formic acid, and lyophilized.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	53	 Prior to MS analysis, the protein samples were reduced, alkylated, and digested with proteomics grade trypsin (Sigma).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	54	 The peptides were analyzed by liquid chromatography-MS/MS on a Q-Tof micro (Waters, Manchester, UK).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	55	 All data were acquired using Masslynx 4.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	56	0 software and than processed using Proteinlynx module.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	57	 The processed data were searched against updated NCBInr and Sprot data bases using the Mascot search engine.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	58	 Mascot probability-based Mowse individual ion scores of  > 46 were accepted as indicating identity or extensive homology (p  <  0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	59	 The MS/MS spectrum scores between 20 and 45 were examined individually, with the acceptance criteria being that the parent and fragment ion masses were within the calibrated tolerance limits and that the spectrum contained an extended series of consecutive y- or b- ions.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	60	 Small scale experiments analyzed by Western blot were performed using lysates from two 100-mm dishes of Calu-3 cells and 2 nmol of CFTR peptide.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	61	In Vitro Binding Assays Binding assays were performed as described previously, with several exceptions (21, 23).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	62	 Briefly, the cDNA sequence of the human PP2A B' subunit was amplified by PCR and cloned into the BamHI and XhoI sites of pET-28C (Novagen, Madison, WI).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	63	 Recombinant B' subunit was produced in either rabbit reticulocyte lysates (Promega, Madison, WI) or BL21 Escherichia coli (Stratagene, La Jolla, CA).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	64	 For reticulocyte lysates, the PP2A B' subunit was purified using Ni2+-nitrilotriacetic acid beads (Qiagen) in binding buffer (50 mM Tris-Cl (pH 7.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	65	 To remove any reticulocyte proteins that co-purify with the B' subunit, the beads were washed three times in binding buffer plus 2 M urea followed by three washes in binding buffer.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	66	 The B' subunit was eluted with binding buffer plus 10 mM EDTA.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	67	 Bacterially, expression of B' subunit was performed as previously described (24).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	68	 Purified PP2A core dimer consisting of the catalytic and A regulatory subunit was obtained from Promega (Madison, WI).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	69	Purified proteins were then incubated with indicated CFTR peptides immobilized to streptavidin beads in binding buffer plus 0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	70	2% bovine serum albumin for 1 h at 4 degrees C.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	71	 Following extensive washing, the bound proteins were eluted, resolved by SDS-PAGE, and analyzed by Western blot or phosphorimaging analysis.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	72	Co-immunoprecipitation and Phosphatase Assays Calu-3 cells were scraped into a hypotonic lysis buffer (150 mM Tris-Cl, 10 mM NaCl, and protease inhibitors) and physically disrupted by Dounce homogenization on ice.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	73	 The lysates were centrifuged at 500 x g for 10 min to remove nuclei and unbroken cells.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	74	 The supernatant was subsequently centrifuged at 100,000 x g for 1 h to pellet cell membranes.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	75	 Membranes were resuspended in binding buffer for 1 h on ice.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	76	 CFTR was immunoprecipitated using CFTR 596 antibodies (gift of Dr.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	77	 Riordan, University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, NC) or isotype-matched control antibodies covalently conjugated to Protein G dynabeads.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	78	 Bound proteins were washed extensively and analyzed by Western blot using specific antibodies for PP2A subunits or for phosphatase activity using a PP2A immunoprecipitation phosphatase assay kit (Upstate%20Biotechnology">Upstate Biotechnology).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	79	CFTR Currents in Outside-out Membrane Patches of Calu-3 Cells The procedures were essentially as described previously (6).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	80	 Briefly, CFTR Cl- channel activity was recorded at a membrane potential of 30 mV with a 6-8-megaohm resistance for an open pipette.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	81	 Both the pipette and the bath solutions were the same as described previously (6).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	82	 CFTR channel activity was recorded digitally (PClamp software) for 300 s following patch excision.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	83	 PP2A inhibitors or protein kinase A inhibitor was included in the pipette solution as indicated.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	84	CFTR Currents in Mouse Jejunum Details of this approach have been described previously (25, 26).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	85	 Briefly, sections of the midportion of mouse jejunum were studied under short circuit current (Isc) conditions during a 90-min recording.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	86	 A constant voltage pulse (1-5 mV, 1-s duration) was applied to the tissue every minute (Physiologic Instruments, San Diego, CA).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	87	 Potential difference and resistance were calculated by Ohm's law from the changes in Isc in response to the voltage pulse.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	88	 Tissues were treated with 100  microM endothall or vehicle.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	89	Confocal Microscopy Measurement of Periciliary Liquid (PCL) The technique has been described in detail (27).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	90	 Briefly, phosphate-buffered saline (20  microl) containing 2 mg/ml Texas Red-dextran (10 kDa; Molecular Probes, Inc.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	91	, Eugene, OR) and benzamil (10-4 M) was added to cultured bronchial epithelium, and excess was aspirated to bring PCL height to 7  microm.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	92	 The CFTR-specific inhibitor CFTRinh172 was also included where noted at a concentration of 10-5 M.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	93	 To measure the average height of the PCL, five predetermined points (one central and four 2 mm from the edge of the culture) were XZ-scanned as previously described (27).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	94	 For all studies, perfluorocarbon was added mucosally to prevent evaporation of the PCL, and the culture was placed on the stage of the confocal microscope over a serosal reservoir (80  microl of TES-buffered Ringer).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	95	 Okadaic acid was added to the apical surface as a dry powder in perfluorocarbon (5  microg of okadaic acid/25 ml of perfluorocarbon/cm2 of culture).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	96	 Perfluorocarbon has no effect on PCL height or ion transport, as previously described (27).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	97	   RESULTS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   PP2A Physically Associates with the COOH Terminus of CFTR The COOH terminus of CFTR mediates protein-protein interactions with PDZ proteins (7, 28-30), the adaptor protein AP-2 (31), and AMP kinase (12) to regulate cell surface stability, membrane trafficking, and channel activity.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	98	 In the present study, we asked whether the highly conserved CFTR COOH terminus can interact with additional proteins that regulate channel function.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	99	 We chose to focus on the last 25 amino acids of CFTR (encompassing residues 1451-1476), which precede, but do not include, the PDZ binding motif.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	100	 Previous studies suggest that this region is important for CFTR trafficking and channel activity (32); however, no protein interactions have been reported.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	101	 We immobilized biotinylated CFTR-(1451-1476) peptides on streptavidin-agarose beads, incubated the peptides in cell lysates prepared from Calu-3 cells, and eluted the bound proteins with formic acid.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	102	 Using nanoliquid chromatography MS/MS, we identified the serine/threonine protein phosphatase PP2A associated with CFTR-(1451-1476).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	103	 PP2A dephosphorylates CFTR in vitro and decreases channel activity in multiple cell systems (14, 16, 18, 19).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	104	 (33) also identified an interaction between the regulatory domain of CFTR and PP2A, suggesting that PP2A anchoring to CFTR may involve multiple contacts.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	105	View larger version (31K):    FIGURE 1.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	106	 MS analysis of PP2A subunits associated with the CFTR COOH terminus.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	107	 A, table of PP2A subunit peptides identified by MS/MS analysis of Calu-3 cell proteins associated with CFTR-(1451-1476).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	108	 B, example of an MS/MS spectrum used to specifically identify the B' subunit.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	109	 y ions and corresponding amino acids are labeled on the spectrum.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	110	  PP2A is a major cellular phosphatase that regulates many protein targets.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	111	 PP2A functions as a heterotrimeric complex composed of a catalytic subunit and two regulatory subunits, A and B (34).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	112	 The specificity of PP2A is determined by the unique combination of regulatory subunits associated with the catalytic subunit.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	113	 The A regulatory subunit is encoded by one of two genes and , which are 86% identical.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	114	 The A regulatory subunit is tightly associated with the catalytic subunit and functions as a scaffold to recruit the B regulatory subunit.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	115	 The B regulatory subunit is highly divergent in comparison with the other PP2A subunits.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	116	 The B regulatory subunit is divided into the B, B', B'', and B''' families, which are encoded by at least 14 different genes, some of which produce as many as five splice variants.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	117	 The diversity of regulatory subunits gives rise to over 75 distinct PP2A enzymes.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	118	 By mass spectrometry, we observe peptides from all three PP2A subunits (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	119	 Importantly, the MS/MS spectra provide amino acid sequence information that allowed us to precisely identify the PP2A regulatory subunits associated with CFTR-(1451-1476) as A and B' (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	120	By Western blot, we confirmed that the PP2A catalytic, A regulatory, and B' regulatory subunits associate with CFTR-(1451-1476) but not other CFTR C-terminal peptides (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	121	 Furthermore, these PP2A subunits also co-precipitate with endogenous CFTR from Calu-3 cell membranes (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	122	 2B), consistent with an interaction in vivo.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	123	 The PP2A B subunit, which is structurally unrelated to the B' family, does not co-purify with CFTR-(1451-1476) or co-immunoprecipitate with endogenous CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	124	 In addition, we asked whether PP2A phosphatase activity purified with full-length CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	125	 CFTR immunoprecipitates were assayed for PP2A using a colorimetric phosphatase assay.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	126	 We find that a PP2A-like activity specifically co-precipitates with CFTR, but not an IgG control (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	127	 Characteristic of PP2A, the phosphatase activity was inhibited by 1  microM okadaic acid or 1  microM endothall, potent inhibitors of PP2A (IC50 = 0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	128	 Although okadaic acid and endothall can also inhibit PP1 (IC50 = 10 nM and 5  microM, respectively), previous studies have found no evidence to support the ability of PP1 to physically associate with CFTR, to dephosphorylate CFTR in vitro, or regulate channel activity (13, 18, 20).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	129	 Although PP2C has been shown to be associated with CFTR in baby hamster kidney cells, the assay buffer does not contain Mg2+, which is required for PP2C activity.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	130	 Taken together, these data suggest that the phosphatase activity associated with CFTR is PP2A.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	131	View larger version (35K):    FIGURE 2.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	132	 The PP2A heterotrimer co-purifies with CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	133	 A, biotinylated CFTR peptides were immobilized on streptavidin beads and incubated in Calu-3 cell lysates.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	134	 Bound proteins were resolved by SDS-PAGE and analyzed by Western blot using antibodies against the PP2A catalytic, A regulatory, B' regulatory, and B regulatory subunits.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	135	 B and C, Calu-3 cell lysates were incubated with either anti-CFTR monoclonal antibodies or isotype-matched mouse IgG covalently coupled to protein G dynabeads.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	136	 The beads were extensively washed and analyzed by Western blot using specific PP2A subunit antibodies (B) or assayed for serine/threonine phosphatase activity using an Upstate%20Biotechnology">Upstate Biotechnology phosphatase assay kit (C).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	137	 To determine the contribution of PP2A to the total phosphatase activity, the PP2A inhibitors okadaic acid or endothall were added during the phosphatase assay (n = 4 for each condition).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	138	 The data represent mean values (n = 5)  plus or minus  S.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	139	 IP, immunoprecipitation; IB, immunoblotting.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	140	  The PP2A B' Subunit Binds Directly to the COOH Terminus of CFTR It is clear that multiple phosphatases can regulate CFTR channel activity.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	141	 However, the degree to which PP2A contributes to this regulation varies in different functional assays and cell systems.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	142	 Given the diversity of PP2A enzymes, we were intrigued by the possibility that the B regulatory subunit may, in part, account for these differences.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	143	 Therefore, we asked whether the PP2A B' subunit could interact directly with CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	144	 We find that PP2A B' subunit expressed and purified from reticulocyte lysates binds to CFTR-(1451-1476) but not other CFTR C-terminal peptides (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	145	 NHERF-1, previously shown to interact with the extreme COOH terminus of CFTR, is enriched by the CFTR-(1471-1480) peptide, demonstrating the specificity of this assay (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	146	 Although we do not find the catalytic or A subunit associated with the purified B' subunit from reticulocyte lysates (data not shown), we cannot rule out the possibility that these subunits are present at low levels and may be influencing binding to CFTR-(1451-1476).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	147	 Using bacterially expressed, purified B' subunit, we observe direct and dose-dependent binding to CFTR-(1451-1476) (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	148	 Furthermore, we also find that the core PP2A dimer, composed of the catalytic and A regulatory subunit, do not bind to CFTR-(1451-1476) unless the B' subunit is present (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	149	 Whereas it is not clear whether the B' subunit alone is necessary and sufficient for targeting PP2A to CFTR, these data suggest that the B' subunit may play a critical role in the binding specificity.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	150	PP2A Localizes to the Apical Cell Surface of Airway Epithelia If PP2A is a physiologically relevant CFTR phosphatase, we reasoned that its subcellular localization should partially overlap with CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	151	 Given the large number of PP2A substrates, we expect the ubiquitously expressed catalytic and tightly coupled A regulatory subunits to have a broad cellular distribution.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	152	 However, specific B regulatory subunits, which target the PP2A enzyme to distinct subcellular compartments, should have a more restricted localization.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	153	 Using a pan-B' antibody, which recognizes all five gene products (, , , , and ), we examined the localization of PP2A in the human airway.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	154	 The B' subunits exhibit a broad subcellular distribution in the human airway (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	155	 We find that B' staining strongly localizes to the apical membrane of ciliated cells in superficial epithelia and gland ducts, consistent with the localization of CFTR in these tissues.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	156	 Although we cannot unambiguously attribute the apical localization to the B' subunit, it is likely that this staining reflects the distribution of one or a combination of the cytosolic B' subunits, B', B', B', and B' (35).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	157	 In addition, we observe staining of perinuclear membranes and nuclear speckles, which is consistent with the observation that the B' and B' localize to the nucleus (35, 36).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	158	View larger version (20K):    FIGURE 3.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	159	 The B' subunit directly interacts with the CFTR-(1451-1476).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	160	 A, the indicated CFTR COOH-terminal peptides were immobilized and incubated with radiolabeled B' subunit or NHERF-1.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	161	 The bound fraction was separated by SDS-PAGE and analyzed by phosphorimaging analysis.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	162	 B, 2  microM CFTR-(1411-1441) or CFTR-(1451-1476) was immbolized and incubated with bacterially expressed B' subunit at the indicated concentrations.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	163	 Bound proteins were washed and analyzed by Western blot using a pan-B' antibody.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	164	 C, immobilized CFTR-(1411-1441) or CFTR-(1451-1476) was incubated with purified PP2A core dimer (0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	165	05 units) with or without B' (1  microg).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	166	 Samples were analyzed by Western blot using PP2A subunit antibodies.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	167	View larger version (99K):    FIGURE 4.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	168	 The PP2A B' regulatory subunit localizes to the apical compartment of ciliated airway cells.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	169	 Shown are representative images of the PP2A B' regulatory subunit localization in gland ducts and superficial epithelium of the human airway.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	170	 Confocal images were acquired in four channels with independent laser sources: left, differential interference contrast (DIC) and nuclear staining (4',6-diamidino-2-phenylindole; blue); center, actin cytoskeleton (rhodamine phalloidin; red); right, PP2A B' subunit family (green).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	171	 The arrowheads indicate regions of apical staining.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	172	 The bottom panel shows IgG controls on sections of superficial epithelium (S.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	173	  As we expected, the PP2A catalytic and A regulatory subunits are more broadly localized in airway epithelia (data not shown) but clearly localized to the apical cell surface of ciliated cells.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	174	 The antibodies directed against the catalytic and A regulatory subunits detect both gene products for each subunit.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	175	 Thus, these antibodies label every PP2A molecule that we expect to give a broad distribution in all cell types.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	176	 Whereas the pan-B' antibody detects five distinct gene products, this still only represents one of four families of the highly divergent PP2A B regulatory subunit.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	177	 Accordingly, the staining pattern for the B' subunit exhibits a more restricted distribution, including the apical cell surface.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	178	 These localization data support our biochemical evidence for an in vivo interaction between CFTR and PP2A.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	179	 Furthermore, the PP2A subunits are concentrated at the apical cell surface, suggesting a potential role in regulating the channel activity of CFTR at the plasma membrane.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	180	PP2A Inhibition Prevents CFTR Rundown in Excised Patches Our previous work and the results of others are consistent with the membrane localization of the cAMP signaling machinery that regulates CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	181	 In excised membrane patches, endogenous PKA activity activates CFTR when exogenous cAMP is added in excess or when membrane-associated adenylate cyclase is activated by receptors (6, 9).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	182	 In patch preparations, CFTR channel activity reflects the phosphorylation status of the channel, which is regulated by a balance between PKA and endogenous phosphatases (6, 18, 37).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	183	 Consequently, CFTR channel gating is increased under conditions in which PKA activity is elevated, such as increased cAMP or the inhibition of phosphodiesterases (1, 10).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	184	 We hypothesize that "rundown" of CFTR activity following excision results from a shift in the balance between endogenous PKA and phosphatase activities.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	185	 Based on our biochemical analyses demonstrating a physical association between CFTR and PP2A, we tested this hypothesis by examining CFTR rundown in excised patches under control conditions and in the presence of PP2A inhibitors.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	186	 We compared the average pipette current during the first 30 s of outside out recordings with the average pipette current measured from 270 to 300 s, as performed in previous studies (38).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	187	 Under control conditions, the pipette solution contained ATP and GTP, conditions that allow CFTR gating to reflect the activity of endogenous PKA (6).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	188	 Furthermore, current flow through the patch is mediated by Cl- traversing CFTR, since no channel events are observed, and pipette current is near zero with protein kinase A inhibitor (100 nM) in the pipette (0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	189	 Under these conditions, CFTR activity declines variably over 5 min (I = -0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	190	 However, the presence of the PP2A inhibitors okadaic acid or endothall in the pipette prevented channel rundown (I = 0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	191	88, respectively, n = 10 for each treatment) (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	192	 Although endothall and okadaic acid inhibit PP2A most potently, they can also inhibit other phosphatases such as PP1, PP4, and PP5 (39, 40).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	193	 Therefore, we also tested the specific inhibitor I2PP2A, which does not inhibit PP1, PP2B, or PP2C (41, 42).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	194	 Similar to endothall and okadaic acid, I2PP2A (1.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	195	7  microM) also prevented CFTR channel rundown (I = 1.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	196	View larger version (32K):    FIGURE 5.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	197	 PP2A inhibitors functionally regulate CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	198	 A and B, basal CFTR currents measured in apical patches were generated from Calu-3 cells in the outside-out configuration.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	199	 Patches were recorded under control conditions as outlined under "Experimental Procedures.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	200	" Where indicated, patches were prepared in the presence of okadaic acid (OA; 3 nM), endothall (1  microM), and I2PP2A (1.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	201	 A, representative traces for each condition are shown.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	202	 For endothall and I2PP2A, traces were expanded on the x axis to clearly show discrete single channel events.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	203	 B, summary of the patch clamp data in Calu-3 cells.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	204	 The Isc values for each treatment are compared with Isc = 0 (t test, p  <  0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	205	005) and compared with Isc of control samples (t test, p  <  0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	206	017; Bonferroni's post hoc relative to control; *, p  <  0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	207	 C, CFTR currents were measured in intact mouse jejunum in Ussing chambers as described previously.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	208	 Tissues were treated with endothall (100  microM) or vehicle for the duration of the recording.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	209	 Isc is represented as the change in CFTR chloride currents at time 0 versus 90 min.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	210	 The data represent mean values (n = 4)  plus or minus  S.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	211	View larger version (14K):    FIGURE 6.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	212	 PP2A inhibition increases PCL height in primary human airway cultures.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	213	 A, PCL height was assessed in primary cultures of human bronchial epithelia cells treated with vehicle (phosphate-buffered saline) or okadaic acid (OA;5  microg/25 ml of perfluorocarbon/cm2 of culture) in the presence or absence of CFTR inhibitor 172 (10-5 M) for 10 min.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	214	 The PCL was labeled with Texas Red dextran, and the height was measured by confocal microscopy.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	215	 Representative images taken at time 0 or 10 min for each condition are shown.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	216	 B, summary of confocal data represented as percentage change in PCL height at time 0 versus 10 min of the indicated treatments.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	217	 The data represent mean values (n = 6 for all conditions with the exception of n = 7 for okadaic acid)  plus or minus  S.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	218	 (Treatments were compared with controls by Mann-Whitney U test; *, p  <  0.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	219	  PP2A Inhibitors Prevent CFTR Rundown in an Intact Epithelium Consistent with our observation that CFTR and PP2A physically interact, the effect of PP2A inhibitors on CFTR in excised patches suggests that PP2A is present in the patches and is, therefore, compartmentalized in close proximity to CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	220	 Furthermore, the inhibitor data demonstrate that endogenous PP2A can regulate CFTR channel activity.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	221	 These results strongly suggest that PP2A functions as a relevant CFTR phosphatase in epithelial tissues.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	222	 We also tested whether PP2A inhibitors altered basal CFTR activity in an intact epithelium.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	223	 We measured basal short circuit chloride currents in freshly excised sections of mouse jejunum in Ussing chamber experiments.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	224	 Previous studies demonstrated that CFTR constitutes the major chloride channel in these preparations, since jejunum from CFTR-/- mice do not exhibit significant chloride conductance (43).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	225	 We find that over the course of control experiments, basal CFTR activity declined over time (Isc =-9.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	226	 In agreement with our patch clamp data, we find that the PP2A inhibitor endothall (100  microM) prevented rundown of CFTR activity, resulting in increased chloride conductance during the course of the 90-min recording (Isc = 12.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	227	Inhibition of PP2A Increases the Airway Surface Liquid Height Airway epithelial cells regulate the composition of the thin layer of PCL critical for innate host defense.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	228	 In CF lung disease, PCL volume is depleted, reflecting an imbalance in solute transport across the epithelium (44-47).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	229	 Ultimately, PCL depletion results in defective mucociliary clearance, which supports bacterial colonization and exposes individuals to life-threatening infections (27, 44-48).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	230	 Previous studies have demonstrated that CFTR mediates the majority of PCL secretion and plays a fundamental role in maintaining basal PCL volume (36, 49).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	231	 Therefore, we asked whether inhibition of PP2A would increase CFTR activity and thereby increase PCL levels in primary HBE cultures.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	232	 The PCL was labeled with florescent dextran as previously described (27).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	233	 PCL height was measured immediately before and 10 min after the indicated treatments.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	234	 Vehicle treatment did not significantly change PCL height (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	235	 However, cultures treated with okadaic acid exhibited an 30% increase in PCL height (PCL =+2.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	236	 Because PP2A inhibition is likely to influence the activities of many cellular proteins, we asked whether CFTR was required for the increase in PCL.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	237	 Consistent with previous data demonstrating the importance of CFTR in PCL secretion, we find that the CFTR inhibitor, CFTRinh172, causes PCL height to decrease by 30% (PCL =-3.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	238	 Furthermore, in the presence of CFTRinh172, okadaic acid was similar to the CFTRinh172 alone (PCL =-2.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	239	 Thus, the inhibition of PP2A with okadaic acid increases PCL height by a mechanism that requires CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	240	 These results are consistent with our biochemical and electrophysiological studies demonstrating that CFTR is physically and functionally associated with PP2A in epithelial tissues.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	241	   DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   The compartmentalization of signaling machinery with downstream effectors ensures the specificity and fidelity of signal transduction in response to extracellular stimuli.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	242	 Previously, we demonstrated that CFTR is localized in close proximity with regulatory proteins in vivo, including the adenosine receptor, adenylate cyclases, PKA, and phosphodiesterases (6, 9, 10).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	243	 In addition, many signaling proteins that regulate CFTR activity, including PKA (7-9), protein kinase C (11), PP2C (20), and AMP kinase (12), have been shown to be organized in multi-protein complexes directly associated with CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	244	 The data in the present study add to this model by demonstrating that the phosphatase PP2A is both physically and functionally linked to CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	245	The regulation of CFTR by phosphatases has been extensively studied.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	246	 Whereas it is clear from the work of many laboratories that multiple phosphatases can affect CFTR channel activity, the specificity of this regulation is poorly understood.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	247	 We identified PP2A in a biochemical screen for proteins that associate with residues 1451-1476 of the CFTR COOH terminus.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	248	 The power of our approach is illustrated by the fact that we unambiguously identified the exact PP2A regulatory subunits associated with CFTR by mass spectrometry as A and B'.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	249	 To date, at least 21 distinct PP2A regulatory subunits have been identified (2 A regulatory and 19 B regulatory subunits) (for a review, see Ref.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	250	 Importantly, it is the unique combination of regulatory subunits that governs the enzymatic activity, substrate specificity, and localization of PP2A enzymes (35, 51).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	251	 Thus, the identification of the exact subunits associated with CFTR provides insight into the specificity of CFTR channel regulation by phosphatases.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	252	Using purified proteins, we find that the divergent B' subunit interacts directly with CFTR-(1451-1476) and is required for the binding of the catalytic and A regulatory subunits.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	253	 These data suggest that the B' subunit may target the PP2A enzyme to CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	254	 It is intriguing to speculate that the expression of the B' subunit may account for the differences in the ability of PP2A to regulate CFTR channel activity in different cell types and tissues.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	255	 Many of the CFTR phosphatase studies have utilized heterologous expression systems such as Chinese hamster ovary cells (13), baby hamster kidney cells (20), and Hi-5 insect cells (19), which may or may not express relevant CFTR phosphatases and subunits (13, 19, 20).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	256	 We are unable to ask whether the PP2A B' subunit is expressed in these cell types by reverse transcription-PCR, since there is insufficient sequence information available at this time.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	257	 However, the expression of specific PP2A subunits in these cells should be an important consideration for future experiments.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	258	 (33) reported an interaction between CFTR and PP2A, which involves the direct binding of the ubiquitously expressed PP2A A regulatory subunit to the CFTR regulatory domain.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	259	 To demonstrate the specificity of the CFTR/A interaction, Vastiau et al.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	260	 (33) showed that the overexpressed heat repeats 1-10 cause a decrease in CFTR rundown, presumably due to the disruption of the A/CFTR interaction.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	261	 However, the PP2A B subunits also bind to heat repeats 1-10 of the A subunit and would have been dislodged from the phosphatase complex (52, 53).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	262	 Thus, in these assays, the observed decrease in CFTR rundown could be attributed to the disruption of the interaction between CFTR and both the PP2A A and B regulatory subunits.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	263	 Nonetheless, the anchoring of PP2A to the CFTR chloride channel may involve multiple sites of interaction mediated by the PP2A A and B' subunits.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	264	Previous studies have demonstrated a clear role for PP2A in the deactivation or rundown of CFTR in native sweat ducts, cardiac myocytes, baby hamster kidney cells, 3T3 fibroblasts, and Hi-5 cells (14, 16, 18, 19).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	265	 However, the importance of PP2A in CFTR regulation in epithelial tissues seems variable.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	266	 Thus, we chose to study the physical and functional association of CFTR and PP2A in airway epithelia.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	267	 Indeed, we found that CFTR and PP2A interacted in Calu-3 cells as the PP2A catalytic, A regulatory, and B' regulatory subunits specifically co-precipitate with endogenous CFTR (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	268	 Additionally, we examined the localization of PP2A subunits in the human airway.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	269	 If, in fact, PP2A regulates CFTR channel activity in epithelial tissues, we would expect the phosphatase to be present at the apical cell surface, consistent with the localization of CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	270	 The ubiquitously expressed PP2A catalytic subunit and A regulatory subunit had a diffuse staining pattern, which clearly included the apical membrane of the superficial epithelium (data not shown).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	271	 Alternatively, staining with a pan-B' regulatory subunit antibody showed a more restricted distribution, including strong staining at the apical plasma membrane (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	272	 Thus, the PP2A subunits associated with CFTR are present at the apical cell surface where CFTR functions.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	273	 Since the available B' antibodies detect all family members, we cannot rule out the possibility that other B' subunits other than B' may also associate with CFTR or localize to the apical surface of airway epithelia.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	274	 (54) identified an interaction between Chk2 and the PP2A B' subunit and found that the other highly similar B' family members, B', B', B', and B', were also able to bind to Chk2 in vitro.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	275	 Consequently, other PP2A B' regulatory subunits may interact with CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	276	 However, we did not find an association between CFTR and a structurally unrelated B regulatory family member, B (PR55a) by pull-down (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	277	 2A) or immunoprecipitation (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	278	 Thus, the PP2A molecules associated with CFTR at least appear to be specific for the B' family.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	279	We found that CFTR and PP2A are functionally associated in airway and intestinal epithelial cells.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	280	 In the presence of PP2A inhibitors, CFTR rundown was blocked in outside-out membrane patches from Calu-3 cells and intact mouse jejunum (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	281	 Consistent with our biochemical observations, the presence of PP2A in the membrane patches containing CFTR strongly suggests that these proteins are closely compartmentalized.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	282	 Furthermore, our data suggest that PP2A is a relevant CFTR phosphatase in epithelial tissues, in agreement with Vastiau et al.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	283	 (33), who found that the addition of okadaic acid in Caco-2 epithelial cells delayed channel rundown following forskolin treatment.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	284	 In T84 and airway epithelial cells, PP2A inhibitors did not block the rundown of CFTR following maximal activation by forskolin (15, 20).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	285	 A major difference between our data and data of other studies is that we chose to measure the effect of PP2A inhibitors on basal CFTR currents as opposed to CFTR currents following maximal activation with forskolin or PKA.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	286	 It is possible that endogenous PP2A plays a role in regulating basal CFTR currents but that other phosphatases contribute to the deactivation of hyperphosphorylated CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	287	 Future studies are needed to address the relative contribution of different phosphatases to the regulation of CFTR channel activity in epithelial tissues.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	288	In the airways, the mucus layer provides a defensive barrier that traps and clears bacteria and noxious particles from the airways (44-47).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	289	 The underlying PCL provides a low viscosity fluid that facilitates ciliary beating and mucus clearance (12, 55, 56).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	290	 Based on inhibitor studies, CFTR has been demonstrated to play a central role in the maintenance of basal PCL height (36, 49).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	291	 Furthermore, the loss of CFTR function results in decreased PCL height and increased viscosity.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	292	 If, in fact, PP2A is a relevant CFTR phosphatase in airway epithelia, we reasoned that the inhibition of PP2A should increase CFTR chloride conductance and ultimately increase PCL height in primary HBE cultures.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	293	 We find that the inhibition of PP2A by the addition of okadaic acid to primary HBE cultures produces a 30% increase in PCL height, consistent with an increase in CFTR activity (Fig.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	294	 Additionally, when CFTR channel activity is blocked by CFTRinh172, okadaic acid does not have a significant effect of the PCL.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	295	 Thus, okadaic acid treatment increases PCL height through a CFTR-dependent mechanism, consistent with our hypothesis that CFTR is compartmentalized with and regulated by PP2A in epithelial tissues.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	296	In addition to regulating channel activity by dephosphorylating CFTR, PP2A may also be important for mediating other signaling and trafficking events for CFTR.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	297	 For example, AMP-activated protein kinase, which directly binds to CFTR and negatively regulates channel activity, can also directly interact with PP2A via the A regulatory subunit (12, 56).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	298	 Moreover, the direct interaction between CFTR and AMP-activated protein kinase has been mapped to CFTR residues 1420-1457, adjacent to the residues where we observe PP2A binding (residues 1451-1476) (12).
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	299	 It is interesting to speculate that PP2A and AMP-activated protein kinase may function to stabilize each other's interactions with CFTR or may compete for binding to the CFTR COOH terminus.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	300	In summary, we establish that CFTR is physically and functionally associated with PP2A.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	301	 Our data demonstrate that PP2A directly interacts with CFTR via the B' regulatory subunit.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	302	 Furthermore, we provide the first evidence that PP2A regulates CFTR in airway epithelia, the major tissue affected in CF.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	303	 Finally, we demonstrate that the inhibition of PP2A in well differentiated HBE cultures increases PCL height.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	304	 Because decreased PCL underlies the basic defect in airway clearance observed in CF patients, our data suggest that PP2A may be a useful therapeutic target for CF.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	305	   FOOTNOTES   * This work was supported by American Heart Association Grant 0315363U (to W.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	306	), the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, and National Institutes of Health Grants HL34422 (to M.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	307	 The costs of publication of this article were defrayed in part by the payment of page charges.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	308	 This article must therefore be hereby marked "advertisement" in accordance with 18 U.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	309	 Section 1734 solely to indicate this fact.

0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	312	: 919-966-9792; Fax: 919-966-1856; E-mail: milg{at}med.
0.41414222.16239222.html.plaintext.txt	313	2 The abbreviations used are: CF, cystic fibrosis; CFTR, cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator; PKA, cAMP-dependent protein kinase; AKAP, A kinase-anchoring protein; HBE, human bronchial epithelial; MS, mass spectrometry; TES, 2-{[2-hydroxy-1,1-bis(hydroxymethyl)ethyl]amino}ethanesulfonic acid; PCL, periciliary liquid.
