0.44344512.11054417.html.plaintext.txt	367	 1, 193-202[Medline] [Order article via Infotrieve] 71.
0.44344512.11054417.html.plaintext.txt	368	 141, 349-358[Abstract/Free Full Text] 72.
0.44344512.11054417.html.plaintext.txt	369	 19, 187-198[Abstract/Free Full Text].
0.44344512.11054417.html.plaintext.txt	370	Copyright   2001 by The American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, Inc.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	0	Modulation of Mature Cystic Fibrosis Transmembrane Regulator Protein by the PDZ Domain Protein CAL* Jie Cheng, Hua Wang, and William B.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	1	From the Department of Physiology, Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine, Baltimore, Maryland 21205.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	2	Received for publication, August 5, 2003 , and in revised form, October 6, 2003.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	3	   ABSTRACT TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   We have previously identified the cystic fibrosis transmembrane regulator (CFTR)-interacting protein CAL and demonstrated that CAL modulates CFTR plasma membrane expression by retaining CFTR within the cell.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	4	 Here, we report that in addition to regulating membrane expression, CAL also regulates the expression of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	5	 The co-expression of hemagglutinin-tagged or Myc-tagged CAL with green fluorescent protein (GFP)-CFTR in COS-7 cells causes a dose-dependent reduction in mature GFP-CFTR, independent of its tags.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	6	 Bafilomycin A1, a lysosomal proton pump inhibitor, increases mature GFP-CFTR, confirming previous reports of lysosomal degradation of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	7	 Importantly, bafilomycin A1 reverses CAL-mediated CFTR degradation.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	8	 The proteasome inhibitor, MG132, on the other hand, does not reverse the effect of CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	9	 CAL has no effect on CFTR maturation, suggesting that it exerts its effects on mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	10	 Co-expression of CAL enhances the degradation of CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	11	 We showed previously that CAL reduces the half-life of CFTR at the cell surface.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	12	 Here we show that expression of dominant-negative dynamin 2 K44A, a large GTPase inhibitor that is known to inhibit clathrin-mediated endocytosis and vesicle formation in the Golgi, increases cell surface CFTR as measured by surface biotinylation.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	13	 More importantly, dynamin 2 K44A also restores cell surface CFTR in CAL-overexpressing cells and partially blocks the CAL-mediated degradation of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	14	 These data suggest a model in which CAL retains CFTR in the cell and targets CFTR for degradation.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	15	   INTRODUCTION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Cystic fibrosis is a common lethal genetic disease caused by autosomal recessive mutations of cystic fibrosis transmembrane regulator (CFTR)1 (1, 2).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	16	 The best-known and probably the primary defect in cystic fibrosis is salt and water transport in plasma membranes of epithelial cells lining the organs of lung, pancreas, liver, intestines, sweat duct, and reproductive systems (3).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	17	 CFTR is a membrane protein that belongs to the ATP-binding cassette transport family.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	18	 It functions as a cAMP-dependent protein kinase- and ATP-regulated Cl to  channel (4), as well as a regulatory protein for the epithelial sodium channel (5) and other channels (6), and as a putative receptor for Pseudomonas aeruginosa (7).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	19	 These well characterized functions of CFTR require its correct synthesis, maturation, and trafficking from endoplasmic reticulum (ER) and Golgi to the cell surface.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	20	Misfolded proteins are recognized by ER quality control system and are targeted for degradation in ER-associated degradation (8).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	21	 Immature, wild type CFTR is folded inefficiently in the ER with a large fraction degraded before reaching the plasma membrane (9).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	22	 That which is folded efficiently traffics to the Golgi and acquires complex glycosylation characteristic of the mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	23	 The most common mutation in CF, F508CFTR, is a misfolded protein and is recognized as such by the ER, translocated to the cytosol, and degraded by the 26 S proteasome (9).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	24	 Thus, the predominant majority of the F508 never matures and traffics to the plasma membrane.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	25	The degradation of mature CFTR is less well understood.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	26	 (10) found that both the lysosome and proteasome are involved.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	27	 They found that lysosomal inhibitors increase the half-life of mature wild type CFTR in baby hamster kidney cells transfected with CFTR and in the endogenous CFTR in Caco-2 and T84 cells.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	28	 Interestingly, C-terminal truncation mutants do not traffic to the lysosome.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	29	 Instead, they are degraded in the proteasome (10).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	30	 Thus, CFTR appears to enter different degradative pathways depending on signals within its C terminus.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	31	CFTR possesses a type I, C-terminal, PDZ (PSD-95/DLG/ZO-1)-binding motif.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	32	 Several PDZ domain proteins known to interact with CFTR include NHE-RF/EBP-50, CAP70, and CAL (CFTR-associated ligand) (11 to 15).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	33	 The C-terminal tail of CFTR plays a potential regulatory role in modulating its Cl to  channel activity.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	34	 Adding recombinant NHE-RF or CAP70 fusion proteins to the cytoplasmic side of CFTR in vitro increases the activity of CFTR (15, 16).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	35	 In addition, NHE-RF anchors CFTR to cytoskeleton stabilizing the cell surface CFTR (13, 17).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	36	 Both NHE-RF and its related protein, E3KARP, link cAMP-dependent protein kinase to CFTR (13, 18).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	37	 Moreover, NHE-RF was shown to link 2-adrenergic receptor to CFTR (19).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	38	 Formation of such macromolecular complexes facilitates the efficiency of activation CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	39	CAL (also known as PIST (PDZ domain protein interacting specifically with TC10), GOPC (Golgi-associated PDZ and coiled-coil motif containing), and FIG (fused in glioblastoma)) (11, 20 to 22) is a CFTR-interacting PDZ domain protein that associates predominantly with the Golgi apparatus.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	40	 Overexpression of CAL reduces CFTR chloride currents in mammalian cells by decreasing the expression of CFTR in the plasma membrane (11).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	41	 This effect of CAL can be overcome by NHE-RF, which restores the plasma membrane expression of CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	42	 CAL favors the retention of CFTR within the cell, whereas NHE-RF favors surface expression by competing with CAL for the binding of CFTR (11).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	43	 Interestingly, overexpression of CAL also reduces the amount of CFTR (23).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	44	 These findings point to a role for CAL in the intracellular trafficking of CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	45	 Consistent with this notion, CAL interacts with proteins involved in membrane vesicle trafficking such as the SNARE protein, syntaxin 6, and the small GTPase, TC10 (20, 22).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	46	 Furthermore, CAL also interacts with and potentially regulates the intracellular trafficking of the Wnt receptors, frizzled 5 and 8, neural members of the epidermal growth factor receptor family, CALEB/NGC (21, 24), and the chloride channel, CLC-3B (23).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	47	Recently, PDZ domain interactions were found to be involved in trafficking of other plasma membrane proteins both to and from the plasma membrane.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	48	 For example, synapse-associated protein 102 is involved in the delivery of N-methyl-D-aspartate receptors to the cell surface (25).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	49	 In addition, NHE-RF regulates 2-adrenergic receptor recycling to plasma membrane (26).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	50	In addition to the PDZ domain, the C-tail of CFTR contains motifs for endocytosis.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	51	 A tyrosine motif at the C terminus of CFTR binds directly with the  micro light chain of the AP2 complex involved in sorting CFTR for endocytosis into clathrin-coated pits (27).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	52	 Surface CFTR is endocytosed rapidly.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	53	 For example, within 5 min, 50% CFTR at the plasma membrane is endocytosed via AP2 clathrin-coated pits.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	54	 CFTR contained within endosomes can be either recycled back to the plasma membrane or degraded in the lysosome.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	55	 Because surface CFTR has a long half-life (24 to 48h), the majority of CFTR must be recycled back to the cell surface instead of targeted to the lysosome for degradation.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	56	 It is not clear how this process is regulated.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	57	 In this study, we examined the role of CAL on the expression of mature CFTR protein.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	58	 We found that CAL regulates the expression of mature CFTR through mechanisms that are both bafilomycin A1- and dynamin 2-sensitive.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	59	   EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Cell Culture and Transfection African green monkey kidney cells (COS-7) (obtained from American Type Tissue Culture) were maintained in DMEM, 20 mM L-glutamine, 100 unit/ml penicillin, 100  microg/ml streptomycin, and 10% fetal calf serum.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	60	 Media and other components were purchased from (Invitrogen).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	61	 The COS-7 cells were transfected using LipofectAMINE 2000 (Invitrogen) according to the manufacturer's instructions.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	62	Immunoblotting The cells were harvested and processed as described previously (11).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	63	 Briefly, the cells were solubilized in lysis buffer (50 mM NaCl, 150 mM Tris-HCl, pH 7.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	64	4, 1% Nonidet P-40, and complete protease inhibitor; Roche Applied Sciences).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	65	 The cell lysates were spun at 14,000 x g for 15 min at 4  degrees C to pellet insoluble material.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	66	 The supernatants were subjected to SDS-PAGE and Western blotting followed by ECL (Amersham Biosciences).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	67	 The chemiluminescence signal on the polyvinylidene difluoride membrane was directly captured by FujiFilm LAS-1000 plus system with 1,300,000-pixel cooled CCD camera that has 3.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	68	 Quantification was carried out within the linear range using the Image Gauge version 3.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	69	 GFP-CFTR and Dyn2-GFP were detected with polyclonal GFP antibody (1:1000; BD Biosciences, Boston, MA).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	70	 HA-CAL was detected with monoclonal HA antibody (1:2000; Roche Applied Sciences).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	71	 Tubulin was detected with monoclonal tubulin antibody (1: 1000; Sigma).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	72	Surface Biotinylation Surface biotinylation of CFTR at the plasma membrane was described previously (11).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	73	 Briefly, the cell surface proteins were labeled with cell-impermeable EZ-LinkTM Sulfo-NHS-SS-Biotin (sulfosuccinimidyl-2-(biotinamido)ethyl-1,3-dithiopropionate; Pierce) at 4  degrees C for 15 min.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	74	 The cell surface proteins were isolated by incubating with immobilized NeutrAvidin beads at 4  degrees C for 2 h (Pierce; catalog number 53151).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	75	 The bound proteins were eluted with 2x Laemmli sample buffer supplemented with 100 mM dithiothreitol at 42  degrees C for 30 min.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	76	 The eluted proteins were subjected to SDS-PAGE and Western blotting followed by ECL (Amersham Biosciences).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	77	 GFP-CFTR was detected with polyclonal GFP antibody (1:1000; BD Biosciences).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	78	Pulse-Chase COS-7 cells were washed twice in methionine/cysteine-free DMEM and then incubated for 30 min in methionine/cysteine free-DMEM.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	79	 The cells were incubated in methionine/cysteine free DMEM containing TRAN-35S-label (250  microCi/ml) for 30 min.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	80	 Subsequently, the cells were washed extensively with DMEM containing 10 mM of unlabeled methionine and 10 mM of unlabeled cysteine and chased in this solution for the indicated times.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	81	 Radiolabeled CFTR was immunoprecipitated with M3A7 and L12B14 monoclonal antibodies (Upstate, Waltham, MA), separated on 7.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	82	5% SDS-PAGE, dried, and visualized by autoradiography.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	83	 The radioactive signal on the dried SDS-PAGE was scanned with a FujiFilm BAS-100 system (FujiFilm).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	84	 Quantification was carried out within the linear range using the Image Gauge version 3.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	85	Confocal Microscopy COS-7 cells were plated on glass coverslips 1 day before transfection.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	86	 The cells were fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde and permeabilized in 0.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	87	2% Nonidet P-40 1 day post-transfection.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	88	 Nonspecific binding sites were blocked with 5% normal goat serum.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	89	 The cells were stained with anti-HA monoclonal antibody (1:2000; Roche Applied Sciences) in 5% normal goat serum, washed with 1% bovine serum albumin, and incubated with goat anti-mouse Cy3 secondary antibodies in 1% normal goat serum (1:200; Jackson ImmunoResearch, West Grove, PA).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	90	 The GFP signal was detected by its fluorescence.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	91	 The specimens were mounted and viewed on the UltraVIEW spinning disk confocal microscope (PerkinElmer Life Sciences).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	92	Calculation of Degradation The percentage of bafilomycin A1-sensitive CFTR degradation was calculated as follows: [CFTRbafilomycin A1-treated  to  CFTRuntreated]/CFTRbafilomycin A1-treated x 100%.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	93	Statistical Analysis The data are presented as the means  plus or minus  S.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	94	 Statistical significance was determined by Student's t test.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	95	 We assigned significance at p  <  0.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	96	   RESULTS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Is Expression of Mature CFTR Protein Influenced by CAL?  Co-expression of CAL reduces the total cellular CFTR (23).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	97	 To confirm these observations, we co-transfected GFP-CFTR into COS-7 cells with different concentrations of either HA- or Myc-tagged CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	98	 GFP-CFTR was previously shown to have the single channel properties and intracellular trafficking patterns similar to that of wild type CFTR (28).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	99	 1 depicts the steady state levels of CFTR, HA-CAL, and tubulin, which is used to assess protein loading.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	100	 Note that CFTR resolves into two bands that are well known to correspond to the upper mature C-band (fully glycosylated) and the lower immature B band (core glycosylated) of CFTR (29).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	101	 Note that expression of either type of tagged CAL construct significantly reduced steady state levels of the mature band of CFTR assayed at 48 h post-transfection.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	102	 Consistent with previous results (23), the effects of CAL on mature CFTR were dose-dependent and independent of the epitope tags.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	103	 Both results argue that CAL down-regulates CFTR mature protein in a specific fashion.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	104	 For example, the abundance of tubulin, a cytoskeleton protein, was not affected by either HA-CAL (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	105	 Likewise, co-expression of HA-CAL or Myc-CAL did not affect the expression of GFP, a cytosolic protein, or GFP-frizzled 4, a membrane protein (data not shown).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	106	 Neither GFP nor frizzled 4 binds to CAL (11).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	107	 All of the GFP-tagged proteins used have the same cytomegalovirus promoters, eliminating a nonspecific effect on promoter activity.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	108	 In addition, NHE-RF has no effect on the abundance of mature CFTR (11, 23).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	109	 These data suggest that CAL does not down-regulate GFP-CFTR by reducing its transcription (see more on pulse-chase experiments later) or by acting on the GFP moiety of the fusion proteins.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	110	View larger version (34K):    FIG.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	111	 Dose-dependent degradation of CFTR by CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	112	 A, COS-7 cells were co-transfected with GFP-CFTR (3  microg) and HA-CAL as indicated.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	113	 The cells were lysed 48 h post-transfection.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	114	 The proteins in cell lysates were separated on SDS-PAGE.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	115	 B, COS-7 cells were co-transfected with GFP-CFTR (3  microg/dish) and Myc-CAL as indicated.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	116	 GFP-CFTR was detected by Western blotting using an anti-GFP polyclonal antibody.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	117	 HA-CAL and Myc-CAL were detected by Western blotting using anti-HA and anti-Myc monoclonal antibodies, respectively.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	118	 Tubulin was detected by Western blotting using an anti-tubulin monoclonal antibody to demonstrate equal loading of total cell lysates.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	119	 C, averages of the experiments described in A and B.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	120	 The filled circles are values from cells co-transfected with HA-CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	121	 The open circles are values from cells co-transfected with Myc-CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	122	 The error bars are the standard deviations.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	123	05 versus the cells transfected with 6  microg/dish CAL (n = 3).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	124	  To verify these results further, the effect of CAL on CFTR was investigated in cells stably expressing a low level of CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	125	 This cell line was created by transfecting COS-7 cells with GFP-CFTR, followed by selection and expansion of isolated G418-resistant colonies.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	126	 One resultant clone, 4F2, was obtained that expressed one-tenth of the GFP-CFTR cells transiently transfected with 3  microg of GFP-CFTR/100-mm dish (data not shown).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	127	 In these cells, HA-CAL also reduced the steady state levels of CFTR (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	128	View larger version (25K):    FIG.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	129	 Bafilomycin A1 reverses CAL-mediated reduction of CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	130	 A, COS-7 Cells were co-transfected with GFP-CFTR and HA-CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	131	 Either the lysosome inhibitor bafilomycin A1 (1  microM) or the proteasome inhibitor MG132 (10  microM) was added 24 h post-transfection.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	132	 The cells were lysed, and the proteins were detected by Western blotting as described in the legend to Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	133	 B, the percentage of bafilomycin A1-sensitive CFTR degradation was calculated as the portion of CFTR protected by bafilomycin A1 (see "Experimental Procedures").
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	134	 The data are the means of three experiments.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	135	 The error bars are standard deviations.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	136	 C, the COS-7 cell line, 4F2, stably expressing a low amount of GFP-CFTR was transfected with HA-CAL (6  microg/dish).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	137	 Bafilomycin A1 (1  microM) was added 24 h post-transfection.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	138	 The cells were lysed, and the proteins were detected as described above.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	139	 D, the percentage of bafilomycin A1-sensitive CFTR degradation in 4F2.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	140	 The data are the means of three experiments.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	141	 The error bars are the standard deviations.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	142	  Is the Degradation of CFTR Influenced by CAL? To investigate the role of the lysosome and the proteasome in CAL-mediated down-regulation of CFTR, we examined the effect of their respective inhibitors.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	143	 2A, treatment with bafilomycin A1, a lysosomal proton pump inhibitor (30), increases steady state protein levels of CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	144	 Our data combined with previous findings obtained with other lysosome blocking agents (10, 11) suggest that lysosomal degradation is an important process in regulating mature CFTR abundance.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	145	 Important for this study is that bafilomycin A1 reverses CAL-mediated reduction in mature CFTR (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	146	 Fig 2A (first and third lanes) shows the typical effect of CAL on mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	147	 In the absence of bafilomycin A1, CAL-transfected cells have significantly less mature CFTR than in cells not transfected with CAL (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	148	 Importantly, after 24 to 48 h of bafilomycin A1 treatment, the effect of CAL is significantly reduced (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	149	 The effect of bafilomycin is likely underestimated.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	150	 Some CAL-induced reduction in mature CFTR was expected to take place prior to the addition of bafilomycin midway, at 24 h posttransfection.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	151	 Thus, some CAL-induced reduction in mature CFTR was expected to take place prior to the addition of bafilomycin.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	152	 2B depicts the extent of CFTR bafilomycin A1 sensitivity (see "Experimental Procedures").
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	153	 At 24 to 48 h posttransfection, 27.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	154	85% of CFTR is bafilomycin-sensitive.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	155	 In contrast, in cells transfected with 6  microg of HA-CAL/100-mm dish, 49.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	156	62% of CFTR is bafilomycin-sensitive (p  <  0.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	157	 The reversal of CAL-mediated reduction of mature CFTR by bafilomycin A1 is also reproduced in the stable cell line 4F2 (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	158	 More importantly, transfection of HA-CAL leads to an increase in the extent of bafilomycin A1-sensitive degradation of CFTR (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	159	 These results strongly suggested that CAL plays a key role in regulating the bafilomycin A1-sensitive degradation of CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	160	 On the other hand, treating CAL-transfected cells with the proteasome inhibitor MG132 did not rescue mature GFP-CFTR (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	161	 2A) back to the control levels observed in the absence of CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	162	 In contrast to bafilomycin A1 treatment, in the presence of CAL, MG132 actually reduced levels of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	163	 It has been observed by several investigators that proteasome inhibition does not increase the maturation of CFTR (31, 32).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	164	 MG132 did not increase immature CFTR in the Nonidet P-40 lysates probably because blocking of proteosomal degradation leads to the accumulation of CFTR into a detergent-insoluble polyubiquitinated form of immature CFTR (32).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	165	 The failure of MG132 to inhibit CAL reduction of mature CFTR is further evidence that CAL can function downstream of the proteosome and influence the degradation of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	166	What Is the Effect of CAL on CFTR Maturation? The steady state level of mature CFTR is determined by new protein synthesis and the trafficking and maturation of CFTR from ER to Golgi as well as post-Golgi degradation.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	167	 To eliminate the possibility that, in addition to enhancing the degradation of mature CFTR in the lysosome, CAL decreases CFTR synthesis and/or maturation, we examined the synthesis and maturation of CFTR by metabolic labeling and pulse-chase experiments.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	168	 3A, COS-7 cells transfected with GFP-CFTR with or without HA-CAL were metabolically pulse-labeled with [35S]methionine and cysteine for 30 min at 16 h post-transfection.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	169	 The cells were then chased in medium supplemented with unlabeled methionine and cysteine for 1 to 4 h to follow the maturation of CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	170	 3A, band B) is the newly synthesized CFTR in ER that appears first.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	171	 Not all newly synthesized CFTR is converted to mature CFTR (band C, upper band); because CFTR folds inefficiently, most of band B is degraded by ER-associated degradation (8).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	172	 3 shows that GFP-CFTR matures similarly whether transfected or not transfected with CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	173	 Therefore, CAL exerts its effects on mature CFTR and does not affect the synthesis and trafficking to Golgi.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	174	 To test this hypothesis directly, the effect of CAL on mature CFTR was examined.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	175	 GFP-CFTR becomes fully mature after chasing for 4 h (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	176	 There is no significant difference in the amount of CFTR in CAL transfected and untransfected cells (40,990  plus or minus  1840 versus 39,284  plus or minus  1464 arbitrary unit/dish, p  >  0.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	177	 The mature CFTR was then followed when cells were chased for an additional 16 h.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	178	 3C, there was less 35S-labeled mature CFTR after 16 h in cells transfected with HA-CAL than with those not transfected with HA-CAL, confirming the role of CAL in the degradation of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	179	 On the other hand, if bafilomycin A1 was added at 4 h in the absence of CAL, followed by a 16-h chase, more labeled CFTR remains after 16 h compared with that remaining in the absence of both CAL and bafilomycin A1, suggesting that degradation was inhibited.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	180	 Of note is that there is more labeled CFTR remaining in CAL-transfected cells in the presence of bafilomycin than in CAL-transfected cells in the absence of bafilomycin.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	181	 Importantly, the fraction of mature CFTR sensitive to bafilomycin A1 is statistically larger in the presence of CAL versus the control (50.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	182	01), indicating that CAL is enhancing the degradation of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	183	 Taken together, these data suggest that CAL does not affect early CFTR biosynthesis in the ER or maturation to mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	184	 CAL retains CFTR intracellularly and down-regulates mature CFTR most likely by enhancing its degradation in the post-Golgi compartments.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	185	View larger version (20K):    FIG.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	186	 CAL enhances the degradation of mature CFTR blocked by bafilomycin A1.

0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	188	 The cells were metabolically labeled for 30 min with [35S]methionine 16 h post-transfection.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	189	 The cells were then chased in normal medium supplemented with unlabeled cysteine and methionine for 1 to 4 h as indicated.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	190	 B, quantification of [35S]methionine-labeled CFTR as described in A.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	191	 The filled symbols are transfected with CFTR alone.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	192	 The open symbols are co-transfected with GFP-CFTR and HA-CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	193	 The circles are immature CFTR (band B).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	194	 The triangles are mature CFTR (band C).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	195	 The data are represented as percentages of radioactivity (cpm) at 0 h for band B and as percentages of radioactivity (cpm) at 4 h for band C.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	196	 The data are the mean of three experiments.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	197	 The error bars are the standard deviations.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	198	 C, after a 4-h chase, CFTR maturation was complete.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	199	 The cells were treated with bafilomycin A1 as indicated and chased for an additional 16 h.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	200	 Longer exposure was used to allow visualization.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	201	 D, The percentage of bafilomycin A1-sensitive CFTR degradation.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	202	 The data are the means of three experiments described in C.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	203	 The error bars are the standard deviations.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	204	  CAL Mediates Mature CFTR through Vesicle Formation Involving Dynamin 2 The large GTPase dynamin 2 controls the pinching of the clathrin-coated endocytic vesicles from the plasma membrane and perhaps the budding of vesicles from the Golgi (33).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	205	 A dominant-negative dynamin 2 (aa), Dyn2K44A, blocks the endocytosis of a wide variety of membrane proteins (34) and is also known to affect the integrity of the Golgi in some cell types (35).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	206	 4 shows the effects of GFP-tagged Dyn2K44A and wild type Dyn2 on CFTR cell surface expression assayed by surface biotinylation.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	207	 Dyn2K44A-GFP or Dyn2-GFP were co-transfected with GFP-CFTR either with or without HA-CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	208	 Cell surface CFTR was labeled with cell-impermeable EZ-LinkTM Sulfo-NHS-SS-Biotin at 4  degrees C, isolated with Neutravidin beads, and detected by Western blotting with polyclonal GFP antibodies.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	209	 Dyn2-GFP had no effect on cell surface CFTR, whereas Dyn2K44A-GFP increased the cell surface expression of GFP-CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	210	 The increased cell surface expression of mature CFTR by the dynamin mutant is consistent with previous reports that clathrin-coated pits mediate the endocytosis of CFTR (36, 37).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	211	 Importantly, Dyn2K44A-GFP inhibits the ability of CAL to reduce surface expression of CFTR, thereby restoring surface expression GFP-CFTR in cells expressing HA-CAL (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	212	View larger version (45K):    FIG.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	213	 Dynamin and CAL affect CFTR surface expression.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	214	 A, COS-7 cells were transfected with GFP-CFTR, HA-CAL, and Dyn2-GFP or dominant-negative Dyn2K44A-GFP.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	215	 Forty-eight hours post-transfection, the cell surface proteins were labeled with membrane-impermeable Sulfo-NHS-SS-Biotin at 4  degrees C.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	216	 The cell surface proteins were isolated by NeutrAvidin beads, fractionated on SDS-PAGE, and detected by Western blotting using a GFP polyclonal antibody.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	217	 B, averages of three experiments described in A.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	218	 The error bars are the standard deviations.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	219	05 versus the cells transfected with CAL alone.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	220	  Next, we examined whether Dyn2K44A-GFP affects CAL-mediated effects on levels of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	221	 The cells were co-transfected with GFP-CFTR and increasing amounts of HA-CAL in the presence or absence of transfected Dyn2K44A-GFP (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	222	 The dynamin mutant does not significantly affect the levels of mature CFTR arguing against a large effect of the mutant on the maturation of CFTR through the Golgi.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	223	 Again, HA-CAL reduces mature GFP-CFTR in a dose-dependent manner.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	224	 Importantly, Dyn2K44A-GFP partially reverses the reduction of mature GFP-CFTR (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	225	 It is not clear whether the incomplete reversal is due to incomplete co-transfection of all three plasmids or whether a portion of the CAL-mediated effect on mature CFTR occurs via a dynamin insensitive pathway.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	226	 However, taken together with the lack of effect of CAL on the maturation of CFTR in Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	227	 3, these data do provide further support for the notion that the degradation of CFTR in post-Golgi compartments is enhanced by CAL causing a down-regulation of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	228	View larger version (35K):    FIG.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	229	 Dominant-negative dynamin 2 partially blocks CAL-mediated effects on mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	230	 A, COS-7 cells were transfected GFP-CFTR, HA-CAL, and dominant-negative Dyn2K44A-GFP.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	231	 Total mature CFTR was isolated and detected by Western blotting using a GFP polyclonal antibody as described in the legend to Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	232	 B, averages of three experiments described for A.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	233	 The error bars are the standard deviations.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	234	 Dyn2K44A-transfected cells do not differ significantly from the untransfected cells.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	235	05 versus the cells transfected with 6  microg of CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	236	05 versus the cells transfected with 9  microg of CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	237	  Dominant-negative Dynamin 2 Redistributes the Subcellular Localization of CAL CAL is predominantly expressed in the Golgi apparatus, particularly at the trans-Golgi network (TGN) (11).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	238	 To further study the subcellular localization of CAL, we examined the effect of dominant-negative dynamin 2 on the subcellular distribution of CAL by confocal microscopy.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	239	 COS-7 cells grown on coverslips were transfected with HA-CAL, Dyn2-GFP, or Dyn2K44A-GFP.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	240	 We have reported previously and others have also shown that CAL is located in the perinuclear region of the cell (11, 20, 21).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	241	 6b shows that Dyn2-GFP is expressed uniformly in COS-7 cells.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	242	 Dyn2K44A-GFP, on the other hand, has a distinctly different punctuate expression pattern (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	243	 6c), consistent with previous report that this mutant blocks clathrin coat-mediated endocytosis and is arrested at the clathrin-coated pits at the plasma membrane (38).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	244	 Whereas co-expression of wild type Dyn2 has no effect on the distribution of CAL (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	245	 6, d to f), expression of Dyn2K44A redistributes CAL to the sites that co-localized with Dyn2K44A (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	246	 6 (g to i) transfected only with HA-CAL but not Dyn2K44A-GFP retain typical Golgi localization of CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	247	 These results are significant because they show that CAL traffics from Golgi and is arrested at the cell periphery, where further progression is blocked by Dyn2K44A.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	248	View larger version (70K):    FIG.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	249	 Dynamin 2 dominant-negative mutant redistributes CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	250	 COS-7 cells were singly transfected with HA-CAL (a), wild type Dyn2-GFP (b), or dominant-negative Dyn2K44A-GFP (c) (top row) or doubly transfected with HA-CAL and Dyn2-GFP (d to f; middle row) or HA-CAL and Dyn2K44A-GFP (g to i; bottom row).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	251	 CAL was detected by a monoclonal antibody to HA epitope (red) and Dyn2 were visualized by green fluorescence (green) on confocal microscope.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	252	 CAL is typically expressed in the Golgi apparatus.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	253	 Wild type Dyn2 has no effect on its intracellular localization.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	254	 Dyn2K44A redistributes and co-localizes with CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	255	     DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   In this paper, we report that co-expression of the CFTR-interacting protein CAL down-regulates expression of mature CFTR protein.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	256	 We previously identified CAL as a novel CFTR-interacting protein and showed that co-expression of CAL retains CFTR in the intracellular compartment decreasing cell surface expression of CFTR (11).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	257	 Here, we show that CAL causes a dose-dependent reduction in the total amount of mature CFTR (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	258	 The proton pump inhibitor, bafilomycin A1, reverses CAL-mediated reduction in mature CFTR (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	259	 Transfection of CAL leads to an increase in the extent of bafilomycin A1-sensitive degradation of CFTR (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	260	 The proteasomal inhibitor, MG132, on the other hand, does not reverse the effect of CAL (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	261	 Pulse-chase experiments indicate that CAL has no effect on CFTR maturation, suggesting that it exerts its effect on mature CFTR (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	262	 3) by enhancing the degradation of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	263	 As we have previously shown, CAL reduces the half-life of CFTR at the cell surface (11).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	264	 Co-expression of a dominant-negative mutant of dynamin 2, Dyn2K44A-GFP, with CAL and CFTR restores cell surface CFTR and partially blocks the CAL-mediated degradation of mature CFTR (Figs.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	265	 These data suggest a model in which CAL retains CFTR in the cell and targets mature CFTR for degradation via mechanisms involving post-Golgi vesicle formation and trafficking.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	266	Both intracellular retention and degradation of mature CFTR by CAL contributes to the CAL-mediated down-regulation of CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	267	 To date, no enzymatic activity has been identified in CAL.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	268	 Examining the protein domains and motifs suggests that CAL is a scaffolding protein with multiple protein-binding domains.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	269	 Like other scaffolding proteins, CAL operates as an adaptor to couple multiple proteins.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	270	 Other than the PDZ domain that binds to CFTR, the second coiled-coil domain binds to the small GTPase TC10 and the SNARE protein syntaxin 6 (20, 22).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	271	 Both TC10 and syntaxin 6 are known to be involved in intracellular trafficking.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	272	 TC10 is a member of the Rho-GTPase family.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	273	 In adipose tissues, TC10 is involved in regulating the trafficking of the insulin-stimulated glucose transporter, GLUT4, to the plasma membrane.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	274	 As an adaptor protein, CAL is likely to link CFTR to the intracellular trafficking processes carried out by TC10 or syntaxin 6 in CFTR-expressing epithelial tissues.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	275	At steady state, CAL is localized to the Golgi complex, particularly in the TGN and cytosol.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	276	 TC10 is localized at the plasma membrane and intracellular vesicles; syntaxin 6 is primarily in Golgi and endosomes.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	277	 CFTR spans all of these compartments.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	278	 For these proteins to work in concert on CFTR, they must physically interact.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	279	 One possibility is that they interact at the interface of their respective compartments.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	280	 Alternatively, one or all of these proteins could cycle among different compartments.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	281	 For example, CAL may traffic from TGN/Golgi to the plasma membrane and then to endosomes and to the lysosome, or it may traffic directly from the TGN to the lysosome.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	282	 6 depicts evidence supporting this notion.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	283	 The data show that expression of a dominant-negative dynamin 2 mutant redistributes CAL to the cell periphery into punctuate structures that co-localize with the mutant dynamin 2.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	284	 In this circumstance CAL is arrested at the sites where dynamin regulates vesicle budding (Fig.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	285	 The dynamin 2 mutant Dyn2K44A is well known to inhibit endocytosis and to affect the Golgi (33, 35).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	286	 The observation that the dynamin 2 mutant Dyn2K44A enhances surface expression of mature CFTR and does not have a large effect on the total amount of mature CFTR supports the notion that the primary effect of Dyn2K44A is post-Golgi.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	287	 Thus, it is likely that CAL can traffic with CFTR past the Golgi and target CFTR for degradation either through endocytosis at the plasma membrane or via direct trafficking from a post-Golgi compartment to the lysosome.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	288	 However, it is important to note that our data do not exclude other ways of regulating mature protein and cell surface expression CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	289	The evidence that CAL is involved in trafficking in tissues other than epithelia was suggested by two recent papers.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	290	 Neuronal CAL contributes to the pathology of Lurcher mice (39).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	291	 Lurcher mutant mice are ataxic because of degeneration of the cortex of the cerebella.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	292	 Constitutive activation of the GluRd2Lc receptor causes an inward current and the death of Purkinje cells.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	293	 Neuronal CAL has an additional 8 amino acids at the beginning of the second coiled-coil domain.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	294	 CAL binds to GluRd2 and Beclin1 and links receptor activation to autophagy and cell death (39).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	295	 Autophagy involves trafficking membrane compartments to the lysosome for degradation.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	296	 Therefore, CAL maybe involved in lysosomal trafficking in autophagy.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	297	More information on the function of CAL came from knockout mouse experiments (40).
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	298	 In CAL knockout mice, the males are infertile.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	299	 The mature sperm of male mice missing CAL lack acrosome, a specialized lysosomal structure derived from the Golgi that is required for oocyte activation.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	300	 In normal mice, CAL is located in the TGN and TGN-derived vesicles of the round spermatids.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	301	 These data suggest that CAL is involved in acrosome biogenesis, perhaps by facilitating protein cargo transport to this organelle.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	302	New therapies are under development to promote F508 CFTR maturation.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	303	 Interfering with the degradation of F508 CFTR in the post-Golgi compartments may be an attractive method to boost levels of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	304	 Our current study suggests a method to accomplish this by inhibiting the degradation of mature CFTR.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	305	 More importantly, a more specific way of blocking the interaction between CAL and CFTR may potentially allow more CFTR to be trafficked to the plasma membrane.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	306	   FOOTNOTES   * This work was supported by Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Research Development Programs (to W.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	307	) and National Institutes of Health Grants DK-48977 (to W.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	308	 The costs of publication of this article were defrayed in part by the payment of page charges.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	309	 This article must therefore be hereby marked "advertisement" in accordance with 18 U.
0.5272462.14570915.html.plaintext.txt	310	 Section 1734 solely to indicate this fact.
